placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: This place is very quaint and beautiful. I was disappointed because we were taken on a tea plantation tour (a small plantation owned by the venue) and told that the tea pickers get paid the equivalent of £2.50 a day to pick 20 kg of tea leaves). There was only around 5 or 6 tea pickers so a very small operation. This is probably the norm in Sri Lanka however when the owner feels comfortable to charge $160 a night, $4.50 a beer (more than anywhere else I went to in Sri Lanka) and  $15 a head for an incredibly average and basic afternoon tea - I'd hope he could do a little more to subsidise his staff. There are photos of the owners family all over the place however they can't even subsidise their staff. It's really sad to see, especially as the owners live locally. If the place wasn't plastered with photos of the owning family, giving it a caring and pleasant family vibe (and not a corporate chain) - I guess this may not have bothered me as much as it did. As this happens everywhere, sadly.  But as a small business, he can help these halndful of staff and chooses not to. However, he can charge an extortionate $4.5 for a can of Sri Lankan non inported beer. Not a place where I'd spend my money again.
title: Bad vibes

ownerResponse/text:
Hello Nadine,

Thanks so much for your comments - great to get a New Year's call to action!

It does seem you rather missed the mood at Ashburnham and it was a mistake for you - or your travel agent - to line it up for you. I'm sorry for that. 

Your disappointment at not having a minibar in the room probably speaks best of the mismatch! The same goes for phones I'm afraid. If people want minibars and room service, Ashburnham certainly isn't a good fit. 

I'm a but muddled at your implication that a stream of other criticisms have been ignored. No alcohol license I'm afraid isn't so much a problem as a fact of life. And of course the vast majority of comments here are very positive. 

I'd also suggest that 3 dinner options - changing every day - is a pretty good range for a 6 bedroom tea estate hotel a long way from a supermarket. 

Will take heed of your comments re. slow service. That's unusual and will be addressed.

All the best,

Max
placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here whilst on our honeymoon and were left disappointed. The location and surroundings were beautiful but the facilities of the hotel are average at best. I wish I had read the reviews before going:  

Service 
- Staff were always a bit of a challenge to find - we often had to go into their kitchen to get their attention for service (there are no phones in the room) no phones are fine if staff are then attentive which was not the case.
- we had to wait 30 minutes for someone to bring us our final bill and repeatedly had to ask if someone was coming to serve us 

Room/ facilities 
- decor is nice but we stayed in the smaller room which as other guests have stated has no air conditioning- only a single plug in fan. The room was stuffy and smelt damp. The bathroom was also damp. There’s no mini bar or any facilities that makes you feel like the price is worth it. 

Food/ alcohol 
- again as other comments have shown they do not have an alcohol licence. It’s possible to get drinks but mostly just a concern that some of those comments were written a while back and yet this has still not been solved.
- food is overpriced. In our welcome book it stated that a 3 course meal is $20 but on the menu board it was $25. There’s limited food options of 3 choices Sri Lankan curry and 2 western options. Being so far from anything you don’t really have a choice but to eat there and it’s def not the $25 they are asking for

All their prices were in $ which also is off putting no other hotel we stayed at in Sri Lanka had that and they were far superior in service, standards and facilities.

The surroundings are beautiful and is ultimately what saved it for us. But I would bother they clearly haven’t taken on board other comments from their customers and it shows. Disappointing and I would avoid- am sure there are other places offering a similar experience where the overall standard of the hotel would match the price.
title: Lacking

ownerResponse/text:
Oh dear. Many thanks for your comments - all well noted. 

Tempting, of course, to address each and all of them but I don't suspect doing so here would make you feel much better so shan't.

A great shame you didn't enjoy time at Ash, as many have in the past. I'm sorry for that. 

It does seem there were some (relatively) exceptional circumstances - drought/continual power cuts - but as said, little point fighting the corner in light of such spirited attack. 

We've some exciting works in hand and, who knows, perhaps we may tempt you back once done (please do email me on max@tonic-lanka.com if open to that prospect). If not, shall settle for accepting that we weren't - and shan't be - the spot for you. 

All the best. 

Max
placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
The location is stunning, high up in the Knuckles hills, with fabulous views in all directions; it’s a 30-40 minute drive up a track off the main road. 
The house should be very charming, but it’s in a bit of a time warp.  It’s in serious need of investment and TLC.  Our room was small and unbearable hot and stuffy during the night - not only was there no air-conditioning, it didn’t even have a ceiling fan.  We noted some of the rooms had rotating fans, but not ours.  The paint was peeling on one wall, which was unsightly.  The internet was hopeless and the electricity was off for much of the day, without any warning or explanation.  The pool was full of leaves and somewhat murky water - the filter obviously wasn’t working properly (possibly because of no electricity).  The food was OK, but the choice was very limited (2 starters and 3 mains).  A young British couple were the ‘managers'; , very pleasant but complete amateurs when it comes to hotel management!  The tour of the tea plantation was interesting and the tea tasting was fun - thank you Mr Das.
title: Fabulous location, but in need of serious TLC

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: We booked to stay at Ashburnham through Booking.com from 25-27 Dec. I wrote to them for confirmation of the booking (as a a precaution) and heard from them after 3 weeks informing me that the resort was in fact fully booked and there was an error by Booking.com. Rex on his behalf did apologize but the time it took to inform me forced to to change plans and look for alternate options in peak season. This is not a review of the resort which I am sure is great (given all great reviews on TA) but anyone booking here please reconfirm your bookings.
title: Booking woes

text:
Literally THE WORST HOTEL IVE EVER STAYED IN. Whatever you do. Don’t book it!!! Pay a little extra and go somewhere else. 

Staff were terrible re service and level and quality of service. I would ask for ice and would wait 30-40 mins before having to follow up on where the ice was. When I’d ask sometimes they’d say they didn’t have any. Which is ridiculous for the size of the hotel. 

Left my room at 7am ,left sign for fresh bedding/ room tidy. Got back at 2.30pm nothing done. Then called and said someone there in 5 mins. 20mins later called back again. Another 20 mins still nothing had to go ask someone down the corridor to help. 

Food terrible and tasteless. Hotel rooms dated and OLDDDDD and not very clean at all!! In addition be prepared to not have a plug socket anywhere near the bed. 

Only good thing was checkout and the beach.

placeInfo/address: Beach Road, Bentota, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
1st and foremost, majority of reviews on page 1 are from 1st time contributors to Trip Advisor, how strange.

As a traveller with corporate and a professional background, I post with experience and authority on 5* hotel properties.

So, where does one begin?

When booking a vacation, we don't use 3rd party agents, Booking.com, TripAdvisor, Expedia, etc., etc., we book directly with the hotel property.

We booked and paid in full for this property during April 2024, for a 3 week stay during January 2025.

5 days, prior to departure from the UK, I emailed the property confirming my booking, and advising our expected arrival time due to overnight flight (we included and paid for an additional night)

Despite requesting an acknowledgement to my email, the hotel failed to reply with a courteous or acknowledge my email.

On arrival at the property, the hotel had no confirmation for my booking!!

We we're offered "complementary" breakfast whilst this was looked into (we paid in advance for breakfast, given we'd paid for an extra night's accommodation.

Eventually, I had to produce the invoice I paid in April 2024, it turns out, I paid a company call "United Hotels" this is the parent company of EKHO SURF Bentota.

Once my invoice was confirmed, via the hotel contacting "United Hotels" we were taken to our room.

The room offered 244 was NOT the room we had booked and paid for.

Back to reception, explaining that the room offered was not what we had booked as per our invoice, eventually, we were offered a "complementary" upgrade, so, now we have 2 "complementary" offers, given both issues we'd already paid for.

Now we are offered the room we booked and paid for, room 218, after dinner and a long flight, we retired to bed early.

Early rise, preparation for breakfast, it's was clear the room was not the standard one was expecting, I'll give a detailed response below.

Once in the restaurant for breakfast, it became evident very soon, the restaurant was lacking professionalism and attention to detail.

Breakfast is an open buffet, food was cold, numerous items were not replenished, bred toaster, one would wait over 10 tuning several time just to achieve 2 pieces of toast, the bread toaster was old and well out of use.

Breakfast plates were left on our table to pile up, despite numerous restaurant employees walking past, not one employee collected our used dishes, on questioning, I was informed, it's another employee's zone!!

Following breakfast, returning to our room, it was clear, this property has serious issues concerning cleanliness, the room was full off dust, had numerous chips in the walls, certain plug sockets didn't work.

We went out for the day, expecting the room attendant to give the room an overall.

On returning, it was clear, apart from the beds being made, and room towel change, nothing, nothing had been done to improve hygiene in the room.

Having now complained to reception about the room standard, the hotel manager came to our room.

I clearly pointed out the hygiene standards, the original issues when trying to check in, the error with initial room availability, due to the room standard, the hotel manager offered "complementary" evening buffet, whilst he and his team revamped the room!!

2hrs were spent with numerous employees trying to bring the rook up to a 5* standard.

During our "complementary" evening buffet, we witnessed a carbon copy of the previous morning issues, food cold, food not replenished, plates left to pile up on our table.

We'd almost reached breaking point.

The following morning day 3, during buffet breakfast, I requested fresh orange juice, I was informed, fresh orange juice is not available to guests, I then spoke to the restaurant manager, again, requested fresh orange juice, I was informed, fresh orange juice is not available, however, as a replacement, orange cordial, pineapple juice, or tropical fruit juice was available.

We departed the hotel, and visited a number of 5* hotels in the area seeking room availability for our stay, we've stayed at these properties previously, Taj, Cinnamon, Centara Ceysands resort.

Given we required immediate availability, Centara Ceysands resort was the property  that assisted, we checked in for the remining 15nights we had in Bentota.

We returned back to EKHO SURF, informed reception we were checking out.

The hotel manager visited our room again, and requested what could he do to improve our stay, unfortunately nothing, 

I made it clear to the hotel manager, and will say here, the lack of hygiene, lack of respect for guests, lack of training, lack of accountability all stop at the door of the hotel manager.

Overall impression, all employees wear the same uniform, so it's difficult to identify who belongs to which department.

No employee has a named staff badge on show, not one, so, if one was to compliment or complain about an employee, virtually impossible without an employee name.

The hotel manager is fully ware who I am, having integrated with him during my limited time in the property.

In conclusion, this is a run down property, lacking in basic hygiene, professionalism, catering for "package" holiday's, and in my opinion, deserves the 2* rating I've awarded it.

Neither the hotel or company brand deserve your custom, given numerous 5* properties are within walking distance of EKHO SURF, Taj, Thaala, Cinnamon. 

As in most replies when one complains about a hotel property, a spokesperson usually replies "on behalf" of the manager, with an attempt to play down the issues raised in a review, rest assured, I mentioned at the beginning of this post, I speak with authority, professionalism, and experience, which is what my observation of EKHO SURF Bentota is based on.

You have the choice whether the EKHO SURF Hotel deserves you custom, or a more valued property close by is more deserving, each one, offering and maintaining a true 5* experience, something the EKHO SURF has a long way to go in an attempt to compete.
title: 2 stars for a 2 star property.

text:
Я пятый раз пишу сюда отзыв, а Вы его удаляете !! Отель ужасный!! В очередной раз мне непонятно кто пишет такие положительные отзывы!! Мы были в ноябре 2024 , находясь там еще,  я 3 раза писала отзыв, который оч быстро пропадал!!  Вернемся к отелю , чтобы далеко не ходить и скажу сразу, номера СТАРЫЕ И ВЛАЖНЫЕ , что в постелях у них БЛОХИ, которые кусают оч болезненно и потом дикий ЗУД!!! Перекусано было половина отеля, поскольку мы друг у друга видели эти ужасные укусу!! ФОТО приложу в 5 раз !!! Нам меняли полностью каркас кровати и МАТРАС , но особо не помогло, укусы продолжались !! 
Еда ужасная , настолько перченая , даже элементарная картошка и та так перченая, что есть невозможно !! Меня вообще еда никогда на отдыхе не напрягает , но тут настолько все однообразно и не вкусно!! На завтрак кофе растворимый , при огромном количестве фруктов свежевыжатых соков нет!! Единственный плюс,  красивый пляж, серф 10$ !!! Океан с сильными волнами, там есть спасатели и стенд с жизнью спасенных -впечатляет!! Много бездомных собак которые свободно гуляют по пляжу и могут накинуться!! В номере нет штор весит ужасные полотно двигающиеся , нет сушилки , мокрые купальники вещать некуда !! Огромная влажность на стенах мокрые разводы и плесень, но это уже мелочь !!!
title: Шри -ланке нужен сервис!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Agent,

Thank you for taking time to post your feedback on behalf of your client. 

It is true that one of other guest (under the influence of alcohol) had come out and urinated to the open area of your client's room in the late night (outside terrace).

However the guest had already finished the job by the time security entered to the scene and security had taken him back apologizing your client and immediately informed the duty manager.

 Rhe duty manager immediately apologized from your client even though it was done by another guest (as he was under the influence of alcohol).

They had washed the entire area with detergent and haven't stopped there. Duty Manager offered a room change as well.
I believe this is the best that we could do at that time. We are not in a position to take legal actions against such behavior of a guest (as your client says).

But we did every possible effort you make your client feel better even though this was not done by one of our hotel staff.

Unfortunately your client was keep on shouting at the lobby this morning saying "I want this to be heard by every possible one of your guests". I still do not understand why he wanted it to be heard by the world.
With great difficulty I somehow managed to tale him to the lounge area and tried to make him understand that this was out of our control, please accept our apologies on behalf of the other guest.

Yet he was arrogantly said "I will post this in every social media" and then he called you up and gave me the phone.

You were fine at the at the beginning but very rude to me then using "F" language. As a reputed Travel Agent you should have never used such abusive language. I had to stop our conversation as I could not bare your language anymore.

I very clearly and confidently state that your client was never abused or harassed, instead we got harassed for something we never committed. And it was a very disappointing discussion and a situation.

However thank you for your feedback and our sincere apology for any inconvenience even though it was not done from the hotel.

Thank you.

Best regards,

text:
I booked the hotel for a long weekend stay via Agoda, prior to us leaving Colombo i called the hotel just to inform them i was coming and to keep our room ready since i was travelling with my 1 year old and i am currently pregnant as well, when i called them the receptionist informed me that they are fully booked and they have no room allocated for me, i told them i have a confirmed reservation for which i have already paid, her response was " I am sorry but i don't have a room to give you pls contact our reservations "  so it was more calls to them and with some anger - finally i was confirmed my room. 

When we arrived despite informing them we were still seated for over 45 mins and then a lady took us to the room, she opened the door to a very old, badly maintained, stuffy room and said to me Maa'm this is our highest category room with a pool view - i was shocked and i told her i cant keep the balcony door open to enjoy the view since it opens to the pool and i have a 1 year old, it was aluminum door with no windows even to open the blinds up - it was just a fully covered blocked door. Her reply was sorry we are fully booked, despite me requesting for a top floor balcony room when i made the reservation itself. 

I was so tired and angry - my husband had to block the door with a coffee table and our stroller so my Son wont fall into the pool. The room was in such bad condition and not fit to allow any guest to stay. Our TV had no sound, Out WC was not flushing, which they came and fixed but when you do use the flush water just seeps in from the bottom making the entire bathroom floor wet, their solution was to provide me extra bath mats - urgh. It was disgusting. The hot water was hot 1 second, boiling then next minute and icy cold then next minute. 

 Needless to say i just wanted to come home. My stay was horrible!!!
title: Horrible stay at Ekho Surf - Bentota

text:
Super Lage und schöne,  große Zimmer.

Die Qualität des Essens war gut und die Auswahl groß.

Der Fitness-Raum war unbrauchbar; fast alle Geräte defekt.

Der Zimmer- sowie der Restaurant-Service war in jeder Hinsicht inakzeptabel !!!

Selbst die grundlegenden Service-Anforderungen  konnten konsequent nicht erfüllt werden.  Hier eine Auswahl:
- völliges Durcheinander von Stühlen auf der Terrasse, Tische  ohne Stühle etc.
- morgens zur Frühstückszeit Teller mit Speiseresten vom Vorabend auf der Terrasse 
- Getränke auch nach mehrmaliger Bestellung nicht bekommen
- Plätze sind grundsätzlich eingedeckt aber häufig fehlten Messer oder die Serviette oder Gläser usw.
- keiner fühlt sich für unseren Tisch verantwortlich, grundsätzlich bedienten alle alle Tische, ein völliges Chaos
- es gab keinen erkennbaren Restaurant-Chef der eine Qualitätskontrolle durchgeführt hätte
- die Live-Musik war so laut, dass man sich nur stark vorgebeugt und mit lauter Stimme am Tisch unterhalten konnte
- zusätzlich wurde durch eine Bratstation, die ausgesprochen geräuschvoll arbeitet der Lärmpegel im Restaurant auf den einer Markthalle erhöht; von wegen Dining Room

usw. usf. Mann kann es garnicht alles aufzählen.
title: In jeder Hinsicht inakzeptabler Service in paradiesischer Lage - würden wir nicht nochmal buchen

placeInfo/address: Beach Road, Bentota, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
**Terrible Experience at Ekho Surf Bentota**

We checked in at 1 PM, only to be disappointed right from the start. No welcome drinks, and the room wasn’t ready until 2 PM. We were asked to have lunch while waiting, but the restaurant shockingly had almost no vegetarian options—just two varieties of rice, a noodle, and a curry. We were then directed to another restaurant for better options, implying we should leave our son in the first restaurant as he had already started eating the buffet. Absolutely unacceptable!

After multiple requests, we were handed the cafe menu, only to find that half the items weren’t available. With the hotel at full occupancy, this seems like either gross mismanagement or a blatant attempt to push guests towards the overpriced buffet. 

The lunch we finally received was a disaster. The so-called Spaghetti Stroganoff turned out to be cold, flavorless tomato concasse tossed spaghetti. Definitely not Stroganoff in any way! We ate it quietly because, frankly, we were too exhausted to complain anymore.

Adding to the frustration, the extra bed we had prepaid for while booking through Make My Trip two months ago took a shocking 7 hours and countless reminders to be placed in our room. 

While the room itself was decent, there was no room service menu card, and trying to reach reception was a nightmare—no one picked up the phone for 45 minutes! After finally getting through, someone brought us a tattered menu with scribbles all over it, and again, many items weren’t available. Ordering food became an ordeal.

As we await dinner, our expectations are at rock bottom. We can only hope to survive the next 48 hours in this place.

#SriLankaTourism #EkhoSurfHotel #PoorServiceStandards #HorribleHospitality #NeverAgain
title: Our stay at Ekho Surf Bentota has been nothing short of a disaster. From the moment we checked in, the service was appal

ownerResponse/text:
Dear guest,

It is extremely disappointing to hear that you are blaming us for no reason. There were no Bed Bugs (not even in our entire history) but fruit ants attracted to your left open food and leftover fruits.

Anyway, thank you for taking time to share your review even though it is not genuine.

Best regards,
placeInfo/address: Beach Road, Bentota, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
We had felt uncomfortable with beds from day 1 of stay. Noticed small bites on our backs' arms and legs (images attached). Thinking it was simply mosquitoes we had ignored issue until noticing that the two bites were definitely unique and apart. After speaking with several other hotel guests we quickly came to the conclusion that this was a bed bug infestation. 
We had made the hotel manager and reception aware around 16 February that something wasn’t right with the beds, only to be told that we would be given another room once it becomes available. As this didn’t happen for a good week, we then approached our Tui rep on the 24 February. Hence the above date of incident is technically incorrect as the matter was raised with the hotel manager at least a week prior to the recorded incident date by the Tui rep. To be fair once the Tui rep got involved, we were given another room the next day.  
The TUI rep attended along with the hotel manager on 24 February. In their report they were quick to conclude that it was as a result of ants due to some raw fruit that we had left in the room. This is completely untrue and absurd, yes we had a few whole fruits that we got from the hotel breakfast, not brought from outside. There were no ants in the original room, after closer inspection it was clear that there were very minute bugs on the beds. Hence bites mainly to our surface areas of skin that came into contact with the mattress.
We were astonished with the report of events from the Tui rep in their email and completely disagree with their versions of events. They had offered to even fumigate our room, due to my wife being an asthmatic we did not accept this offer. The hotel manager moved us to another room on the 24 February where we had no problems. However, in the new room there were considerable number of ants around the inner window seals (image attached).
We have taken the liberty to do some research on open source and were not surprised to find multiple feedback from other guests over the years having experienced the same issue. To reference a few cases, please enter ‘EKHO Surf Bentota bed bugs’ into any online search engine. Many reviews on ‘TripAdvisor, Make my Trip, Trivago’ to name a few. All specifically mention that trip was ruined by bed bugs and some go on to say worst hotel to stay in. Furthermore, reviews date back to December 2016 and also mention that the hotel has not done anything to sort out this issue else would be a perfect stay.        
We actually think that the staff have been great and the hotel and location on the whole has been splendid, so will be looking to add our own fair review. However, we cannot accept the hotel’s/ Tui rep’s version of events that it was due to ants! 
I have also attached the medications prescribed by my doctor following my return, consultation dated 02/03/2024. These are a combination of: -  
Co-amoxiclav: antibiotic to treat infections; 
Fexofenadine: antihistamine that relieves allergy symptoms;
Steroid cream like hydrocortisone cream to ease bedbug bites.

We had endured this uncomfortable room/bed since day 1 of our stay on 13 February until the 23rd February or 11 days of our 15 days stay. We hope our complaint can be looked at again and a fair cash compensation can be offered for our troubles. We had actually selected and paid for another hotel with Tui, namely ‘Coco Royal Beach Resort’. Unfortunately, Tui had cancelled this a few weeks before we were due to travel so had no other choice but to accept else alternatively cancelling our trip and 50th wedding anniversary.

TUI have completely dismissed the claim! TUI don't care about customer complaints nor does this resort. Book at your peril.
title: Bed bugs and ant infestation, hotel+TUI isn't all as it appears to be, so book at your peril!

placeInfo/address: Beach Road, Bentota, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
+ Nice entrance/reception area. Very tasty welcome drink. Super friendly management. Nice room with direct pool entrance. Super nice service team at "der cafe" and the "tuna turner bar".

- Dirty floor in the room. I adviced the managent to clean my room again with clean water. They cleaned it again with dirty water, but added 3 black long hairs to the room. 🤮
The floor was still dirty after 4 days. Ive cleaned a small path on my own with a towel. (See pictures)
Send my dirty clothes to the lundery service and got it back 48h with bugs inside.
Some people of the restaurant service team are complete maniacs when they try to remove your old dishes from the table. We got ask if we are still eating, while eating. 🤡
They tried to steal the food i just got to the table. 
Breakfast and dinner are hot, stressfull and noisy experiences. 
Ordering drinks is weird in this house. Sometimes i asked multiple times to get some water. Once i got the ordered bottle of wine just before i was done eating.
Ordering lunch at "der cafe" takes at least 20-30 minutes. Feel lucky if the food is at least a bit warm.  
Dont try to order drinks in the "comfy bar" in the back of the lobby. The will let you rot in your thirst.

Overall the worst hotel in our 16 day trip booked with "secret escapes".
Hopefully the management will find better people to do the job.
This house has a 5 star potential but gives you 3 star vibes. Very sad.
title: 5⭐️ House, 3⭐️ Service

The check-in time was at 8am and this was confirmed the day before having called the reception. However, we had to wait more than an hour until they get the room ready and the male staff at the reception lacked the pleasant welcoming attitude. Apart from the reservation of a room we also got the day package, where they said the lunch will be either served as a set menu or a buffet depending on the crowd. However, this specific day we got the set menu which was served as a limited menu. The food thoroughly disappointing as the taste was bland and the limited menu was not at all worth it. The prawn cracker had turned into extremely oily papadam served with white rice and pork which lacked any flavor. The tea/coffee served in the evening went straight into waste, as we prepared better teas ourselves. The food was utterly disappointing for reasons beyond comprehension.

Since there was a delay in check in, we got an extra half and hour to check out, and that was like the only gesture which made us happy during the stay.

ownerResponse/text:
Hi Caroline, 

I was expecting a review of this nature. Especially after the ill treatment that you gave our staff in the hotel. 

Please firstly note the rooms are well over 50 Sqm in size and have all the amenities available in 5 star hotels normally. 

I met you personally at the hotel and listened to all your problems, assured you that in some instances we can always improve and yes we do need to provide a hair dryer in every room, which we will look towards doing in the near future. 

For the menu , we have never had a complaint and as explained to you face to face as well , it clearly stated at the bottom that there was a typo by the previous F & B manager who had mistakenly put "not exclusive of government taxes" , I informed you that even though this was clearly a typo , that in a gesture of good will we will honor your request to waive off the taxes and for the hotel to bear the cost. 

Please also note that you made the booking through an online travel agency (Booking.com) and the normal procedure there is that as per policy there is a prepayment made , when the booking period is less than 14 days from check in. 

This money is held in lockdown and the money is returned when the guest paids at check - in, however due to the circumstances you created this took emailing of approximately 10 days from the 3rd of July .

You instead cancelled the booking.com  booking for the first week of July , and asked us to waive off the non refundable fees , and booked directly with us at the front desk, rather than through booking.com

You did not inform booking.com of your actions as well in the process, along with that you demanded a special rate from the hotel. 

You then stayed one night of a three night stay, then well into the second day of check in around the evening you informed us that you had no money and that you needed us to pay for two private taxis to take you to the airport . We told you unfortunately we could do our best and accommodate one transfer at 50% of the cost  and pay it ourselves again as a sign of good will, as we waived off the taxes for the food as well. You then informed us that if we do not pay for your two shuttles that you would then not pay for the remaining two days (this was well into the second day evening when you gave the ultimatum)

We kindly informed that unfortunately we cannot accommodate your requests and that we are deeply sorry , and that instead we can provide you with the solution that we will only charge you one nights stay even though you stayed until 7 P.M of the second day at the hotel. 

We at Roman Beach are always open to constructive criticism. However if an individual wishes to hurt a business , and try to blackmail 
us with boorish behavior , we as a business have to draw a line somewhere. 

We always look to go over and beyond what is required to satisfy a guest, however if a guest demands a special rate, taxes to be waived off the food, a non refundable payment to be waived off by Booking.com for the whole stay, then also demands two free private taxis back to the airport threatening not to stay if not provided , then we have to kindly inform that we cannot stretch our service levels to these unfathomable levels. 

Please also note that only yesterday did we receive an email from the booking person that you received your full funds back into the account and you thanked us as well ! - This 

We have a very hard working team here at Roman Beach , who always look to satisfy a guest and go way beyond what is in their job description . 

Your behavior and treatment of everyone from the accountants team that worked to solve your issues with your finances, to the treatment of the wait staff and demanding taxes be removed because you found a typo is not in good grace and not fair on the hard working human beings that work for Roman Beach Hotel.  

Regards, 
Romantha De Silva
Director - Roman Hotels

text: This is a quiet and small hotel (6 rooms) with some qualities and some drawbacks. Excellent food, friendly staff, good housekeeping, a very nice tuk-tuk driver who may take you to interesting places. BUT: too expensive, the sea is too dangerous to swim in (two locals drowned during our first week), constant "thunder" from the big waves, no sun beds / no umbrellas on the beach, smell of sewage when the room upstairs used the bathroom, very unstable wifi, no serving of alcohol (you may bring your own), no cosy restaurants or shops near by (you need a tuk-tuk to Hikkaduwa village 3-4 kms away).
title: Quiet and isolated

placeInfo/address: 777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: We spend our last night in Sri Lanka there. It was off season (August) so the beaches were empty, neglected and dirty. The rooms are nicely furnished but the whole resort has no soul. The staff is polite but cold inside. We asked for an airport shuttle we wanted to share with a couple we met at the hotel. The hotel said it would be 100 $ for each room, which is a real rip-off. When we organized a much cheaper driver ourselfes they called him and threatened hm that they would trash his car. And that is NOT acceptable and this is why I would never ever go there again.
title: Nice from the outside. Evil from the inside.

placeInfo/address: 777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
I have absolutely no idea why anyone would give this place a 5 star rating. As a seasoned traveler, I I only book the best resort in the location I am visiting. Roman beach received such high marks on tripadvisor and agoda so I did not hesitate to book a two-night stay. Here are the issues we experienced in this hotel.

Restaurant - As we entered the restaurant there was no crew standing by to attend to us. We had to call someone's attention. Customers should NEVER have to call your attention. The sandwich I ordered was average.  The wok noodles were PATHETIC.  The prices were exorbitant for the food quality. Breakfast was Ok, nothing special. The restaurant is extremely understaffed and as a result, service was very slow. Unacceptable. 

Bedroom - 
Issue number 1: The missing remote control. We had to ask FOUR times on multiple occasions before they gave us a remote control for the tv - not something you want to waste time doing when you should be relaxing. 
Issue number 2: Stained sheets. This was feedback i read from a fellow guest in this hotel.  Apparently the resort did nothing about the feedback because we too found stained bed linens in our room. DISGUSTING. 
Issue number 3: Replacement of used towels. Our used bath towels were taken by housekeeping but guess what? They did not replace them with fresh ones. We only realized it after our next bath. Were we expected not to dry ourselves after a bath? ANNOYING. 
Issue number 4: We had leftover drinks from breakfast which we paid for and asked that it be delivered to our room. We got it 12 hours later.

And the biggest disappointment of all - the hotel refused to refund our second night stay. Agoda called the hotel and asked that they issue the refund but the hotel refused. I have it all documented on an email which Agoda sent me. We had a personal matter to attend to the following day and needed to return to Colombo urgently.  The hotel was not gracious enough to refund us for the second night. We were forced to stay the second day and manage our issue remotely so that we didn't have to waste money.

Safety hazard - it rained hard the second night and in the morning when i walked down to the restaurant, i slipped due to a huge puddle of water right inside the hotel lobby. I asked the guy cleaning the pool why there was water and he said it had rained last night. I asked why it had not been dried yet when the restaurant is already open for breakfast and told him that i slipped and could have hurt myself. He just said OK Sorry and when i returned 20 minutes later the water was STILL THERE. Apparently they don't care at all that their guests may slip and hurt themselves from their own negligence. I posted photos of the entire restaurant path area soaked in water. I wanted to speak with the manager but no one was in the front desk area at all. 

A final observation - the hotel is so uninviting and boring. It literally feels like a half way house. They don't play any music in the restaurant to create ambiance and promote relaxation. None of the guests were hanging by the pool because the lounge beds weren't set up. 

The two positive things I will say about this place are: 
1) That the staff are polite and courteous. No one was rude. But please don't think this positive trait makes up for anything. Courtesy and respect are minimum expectations - nothing special.
2) It's a beachfront hotel with a great view of the beach which is also visible from the room. 

To sum it up, the main problem with this hotel is that people do not pay keen ATTENTION TO DETAIL. There is also the absence of a Hotel Manager which is dreadfully disappointing and unacceptable. A manager should be present on EVERY SHIFT. That is how things work in the hospitality industry. These are the traits that sets a place apart from the rest. Roman beach hotel is not a luxury resort by any standard. 

Every resort should give the customer a refund if asked. By doing this, you are showing the customer that you are not desperate to take their money and instead value their satisfaction and experience MORE than making a buck. By allowing the refund I would have very nicely commended the resort and published my comments on tripadvisor and agoda. But since they did not grant the refund, well, no such kudos is deserved and NO REFERRALS whatsoever. 

I will not return to Roman Beach hotel nor will I recommend it to any of my friends in Sri Lanka and the Philippines.  Management of this hotel has a lot of work to do. New hotels are popping up in the area and if nothing is done to improve the level of service drastically,  this place stands no chance of surviving.
title: Impersonal, Inconsiderate, Ghastly Experience, Grossly Disappointing.

roomTip: Find another hotel nearby the airport. Your experience at this hotel will not match its price tag.
text:
Honestly, I cannot recommend this hotel. As a seasoned traveler and someone with experience in hospitality, my stay here was far from pleasant. I arrived around 7pm and due to the dim lighting, I didn't immediately notice how dirty the room was. Planning to stay just one night before my flight, I woke up to find excessive dust everywhere - on the coffee table, desk, bed headboard, and even the floor. The kettle was filthy, and the noise level was intolerable, with footsteps audible from neighboring rooms.

To top it off, the toilet had a conspicuous stain that clearly hadn't been addressed for some time. Additionally, there were dirty mugs left around the bathroom floor and towels, one of which jumped like a flea when I touched it. I documented these issues and showed them to management. The general manager apologized, attributing the problems to the room being new, which I find unacceptable both as a hotelier and as a guest paying $160 for the night without breakfast.

When I expressed my dissatisfaction, he merely apologized again and handed me his card, offering no compensation or attempt to rectify the situation. At checkout, the receptionist nonchalantly assumed that deducting the $10 breakfast cost from my bill was sufficient compensation. I told him that such a token gesture didn't address the magnitude of my disappointment.

After seeing my reaction, the duty manager intervened and eventually offered an extra free night, which unfortunately wasn't feasible for me. Essentially, I paid $160 for an experience that should have cost no more than $20
title: A Costly Lesson in a total Hotel Disappointment

text: A nice airport hotel, if you want Western standards by the airport. However, our plan to get a good night's sleep before leaving for the airport at 6am was ruined by the fact we were put on a corridor with an airline crew staying on it. We were woken up at about 1am as they all left for the airport, and then kept awake by the hotel cleaning team who were turning the rooms around for the next crew to arrive. They had no regard for the fact other guests were sleeping there, the doors to the corridors had no soundproofing. Reception staff didn't seem to care and neither did the member of the cleaning team I spoke to at 2.30am in the corridor. Dissapointing, when all this could be avoided by putting normal travellers in seperate parts of this massive hotel to the air crews.
title: Awful noise levels in the corridors all night

text:
This hotel is a 3 star at best. Everything is old and worn. Very overpriced accommodation.  I'm giving one star for the location, which is excellent for the airport. 

We had emailed a couple of questions through to reception prior to our stay, they went unanswered until it was too late. We went ahead and booked on good faith of the Taj brand. That was a mistake, this has no relation to Taj quality.

No welcome when we arrived from Yasas, we got a mumbled hello and that was it.  I was told to have two people in the room there would be a surcharge, so we paid a double rate ($150 USD) but there is only one of everything in the room. 1 key, 1 cup, 1 bathrobe etc. Bathrobe grubby and frayed. No view of garden and lagoon as our superior room description promised . Rooms smell of smoke although non smoking, place feels like a prison block. No milk for coffee, no bottle opener, no bathroom amenities. 

I would have never stayed if I knew how rude the staff would be, and how poor the rooms and amenities are.   

Everything has been difficult, from trying to engage with the hotel prior to the stay, to checking in, to the rooms themselves.
title: Extremely ordinary hotel but close to airport

text:
I have stayed at the Gateway hotel years ago and you really don't have many choices for airport hotels at Colombo.  The airport was located forty-five minutes away from the city but things are a bit better now with a new toll highway.  However, when you have a layover of less than ten hours (like this occasion), the Gateway Hotel is your only decent choice.  The hotel has a new lobby and the baggage staffs were mostly friendly.  The check in clerk was also friendly and I was given a room quickly.  

However the room was pretty rundown.  It is an upgraded room but the facilities don't quite click.  The bathroom is huge but the amenities have cutback severely.  Not even shampoo or conditioner.  The rest of the room is fine but all the electricity in the room failed an hour after takeoff.  I have to call for an engineer.  Given it was late at night, they managed to find someone quickly.  However, it shortened my sleep time. 

The only good thing is that they answered my email quickly and arranged good airport transportation.  Please note that they no longer have free airport transportation.  

In conclusion, if you have a short layover, the Gateway Hotel is an acceptable choice.  However please expect a holiday inn experience, rather than a Hilton or Sheraton.  But if you have longer layover, please do yourself a flavor and stay at one of the newer nicer hotels in downtown Colombo.
title: Disappointing Stay but the only decent airport hotel option

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir,

Greetings from Villa Republic Galle!

Firstly I would like to mention you that this review does not apply to Villa Republic Galle since you stayed at our Bentota property, Villa Republic Bentota.

But we would like to reply to your review in this platform itself since take all of our guests’ feedback very seriously so we can always strive to improve their experience with us.

You checked in to our property on 14th May 2018 and the original departure date was 15th May 2018. After satisfying with our property and service you even extend the booking for 15th night and checked out on 16th May 2018. 

The first call we received regarding this complain was after you checkout and once you reached the Airport therefore there is no proof that you actually lost money at the Villa. At the same time we have inquired regarding this from our staff members and we have sent Ms Zainab Hussaini an email stating our staff members are unaware of this situation.

Regarding the payment we refuse this accusation since you have made this payment via booking.com and both payments were credit card transactions. Only the grocery bills were supposed to be pay by cash. For grocery bills we always inform guests to settle the provided Supermarket bills nothing more.

We have only three staff members there and they have been with us for more than seven years now.

Our all rooms have safes to keep personal belongings secure therefore as management we are unable to take responsibility over cash/valuables kept outside locked safes. As travelers we need to take safety measurements over personal belongings regardless the place you travel.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your feedback. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience you experienced during your stay. We understand how important a peaceful environment is for our guests, and we are truly sorry that your visit did not meet your expectations.

Please allow us to clarify that our property is built around a unique concept — it is not a traditional hotel, but rather an experience designed to give guests an authentic journey from "leaf to cup" inside a working tea factory environment. As part of this immersive concept, our rooms are constructed to reflect the original structure, and while we strive to maintain guest comfort, soundproofing is limited due to the building’s historic and open design.

To preserve the tranquil and reflective nature of the space, we consistently brief all guests during check-in and have placed multiple signboards requesting everyone to "Keep Silent." Our team frequently reminds guests to maintain a respectful noise level, although unfortunately, not all behavior is within our control.

We are truly sorry for the discomfort you faced and assure you that we are taking your feedback seriously. Measures will be further reviewed to enhance the experience for all our guests. We hope to welcome you again in the future, and we will make every effort to ensure a more peaceful and enjoyable stay.

Warm regards,

Buddhika Kohona
Cluster Manager- Central Cluster

placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text:
Staying at this hotel is a disaster, as the rooms are not soundproof. You have to endure all the bathroom noises, continuous coughing, snoring, humming of songs, and YouTube videos from guests in the next room. You cannot sleep peacefully if other guests are playing games outside at night. It is truly a disaster.

The hotel management should clearly inform guests before booking that the rooms are not soundproof. People travel around five hours from Colombo to reach this place, only to be forced to listen to the unpleasant noises of other guests, with no privacy whatsoever.

Please soundproof the rooms properly before continuing operations. Sitting in the middle of the Pettah train station is far more peaceful than staying in one of these hotel rooms.
title: Worst hotel room ever

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

 

Thank you for sharing your recent experience at Tea and Experience Hotel. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you encountered during your stay.

 

We acknowledge your concerns regarding the room smell, and we have taken immediate action to address this issue. Measures such as spraying air fresheners and lighting citronella oil lamps have been implemented as a temporary solution. Upon investigation, we could not identify any specific source in the rooms; however, we apologize for any inconvenience caused.

 

Regarding the pool temperature, we would like to clarify that maintaining consistent temperatures in an outdoor pool can be challenging, especially considering the current weather conditions. However, we are pleased to note that many guests enjoy the unique experience it offers in the outdoor setting, particularly in colder weather.

 

Your feedback regarding the dining experiences is invaluable, and we are committed to enhancing the quality of our offerings. On a positive note, we would like to highlight the encouraging feedback we have received in reviews about our food. We value your criticism as it guides us in our ongoing efforts to improve.

 

We sincerely appreciate your understanding. Please feel free to reach out to us directly if you have any further concerns or if there's anything we can do to make amends.

 

Thank you

 

Regards.
placeInfo/address: Kabaragalla Estate, Mandaramnuwara 20742 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
roomTip:
1. View from Periya Dorei's Suite, Room number 111 is just a corroded corrugated  roof.
2.Best time to visit Falls is before breakfast. Just 3km trekking 
3pool is useles
text:
We visited Tea and experienced  hotel on 10th December 2023 for a one night stay. We booked family suit and  cheked into Room number 111 . Afterwards, we experienced rotting smell from a corner of the room and called room service to do something about it. Then We went for evening tea and when we came back dead animal rotting smell was not there and replaced by strong chemical  smell.  But when we came back from dinner, the chemical smell was worn off and rotting animal smell came back again. As it was late into night, we tried to sleep under blankets to reduce smell. 

The next day, the morning smell was so bad, so We asked the hotel manager to come and see the situation. He came and inspected the room and informed us that the animal is rotting in gutters and could not do anything about it.

 I have never experienced such disregard for guests in any hotel so far. Isn't it the responsibility of the hotel manager to ensure the cleanliness of rooms before giving it for guests' occupation? 
Even though we booked Periya Dorei's family suit, the only view we got was corroded roof of the factory. It was very disappointing. So in order to keep away from the room, We thought about dip in the hotel pool at around 10.30 am but found it was ice cold. 

We went to this Tea and experience hotel after day at Glendevon Scottish Bungalow, thinking about having a dip in the pool, but the pool was not usable. 

During dinner buffet for Sunday night, Jelly  served in desert to be stale and repugnant. When we complained, Chef came and told us new batch of jelly brought for the hotel taste like that. But on our day of departure, one of the helpers at the restaurant thanked us for complaining about bad food. I feel they are helpless.

 Bread slices given for breakfast on 11th December 2023 didn't seem to be fresh and of poor taste. 

Even though the hotel is situated in a beautiful location and trekking up to KabaraElla Falls, is great, hotel food and room cleanliness are below average
title: Stinky Room, Stale food, and cold, unusable pool. Poor hotel management

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Greetings from the Tea and Experience Factory...

Thank you for taking the time to post a review on TripAdvisor following your stay at Tea and Experience Factry.

I agree with your point about the soundproofing. It is due to the unique design of this historical tea factory, which was explained at the check-in time. We have not come out of the factual environment and done damage to the real structure.

and other points were also taken positively and seriously. and will pass this message on to the top management for further disposition.

We certainly make every effort to deliver personalized service to our guests.

Having enjoyed a memorable holiday with us, we hope you will return soon for a similarly comfortable vacation with unpredictable weather conditions.

Thank you very much again for your comments.
placeInfo/address: Kabaragalla Estate, Mandaramnuwara 20742 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text:
A beautiful location with very nice comfortable climate throughout the day. Set in the midst of a tea plantation, the hotel is a old tea factory converted to a hotel where visitors can experience tea making.

Super friendly and very helpful staff. But badly designed hotel takes away everything the location has to offer. Staff I feel have to struggle to explain the short comings of the bad design. Rooms are not noise proof and the slightest noise can disturb guests.

Food was not great and the quality needs to really improve. I found that the policy of not serving coffee ( because it’s tea experience) a ridiculous policy.

Getting to the location is a task but manageable.

Owners really need to rethink the structure and food.
title: Great weather, nice location. Disappointing structure and not so great food.

placeInfo/address: Kabaragalla Estate, Mandaramnuwara 20742 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text:
Horrible place, it was an absolute waste of a holiday. Wouldn’t even go back if its free.

The rooms are poorly designed, no privacy as you can hear noises in the corridors and other rooms. No common area to hang out, we were given a cold full room with an old machine to sit in. It was cold and depressing. 

I don’t think the manager has any experience in hospitality, as he handled things extremely poorly. We were a group of about 20.  

I wouldn’t recommend this property to anyone
title: Tea and worst experience factory

placeInfo/address: Kabaragalla Estate, Mandaramnuwara 20742 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text:
We visited the tea and experience factory about a week ago in a pretty large group. The staff was wonderful and took care of us and the concept of staying at a tea factory. The views and garden was also lovely. Sadly, these were the only good things I could say about the hotel.

The rooms as comfortable as they were with heating, hot water and beautiful views, were not soundproof at all. We could hear conversations in the next room, people snoring in other rooms and were woken up at 6am to kids running up and down and playing. The menus could have been planned better, though the food tasted good, it was a big mix of multiple cuisines spread across a few dishes where you will have to choose between a rice/ pasta with an indian curry and a veg chop suey.

These sadly werent even the worst thing about this place. We could have forgiven this. The manager made our experience even worse. There was only one common area in the hotel other than the dining room which was the bar. When we asked to sit there the manager refused saying that guests will be walking through there and can hear us. Instead we were made to sit out in the cold in the night on plastic chairs. Wrapped in as many layers as we could just to play some boardgames and hang out. On our second night, upon refusing to sit out in the cold we were made to sit in their engine room which smelled of oil and cement and had a single tube light. Aparently the dining room was being set up for the next meal and therefore we couldnt sit there. The walk through the warm dining room into the cold, dark, unwelcoming engine room was depressing. I only wish I took a picture as anyone would be horrified.

Finally our last straw was being denied being allowed to sit out in the garden and have our afternoon tea (when the weather is warmer) the reasons to which I still do not understand. This hotel was definitely not worth the price you pay for it.
title: Cool Concept but more of a Guesthouse experience than a Hotel.

text: Были с 10.12.2024 по 19.12.2024. Номер большой, убирали каждый день. Двери в номере рассохшиеся, штукатурка со стен осыпается. В бухту пляжа отеля впадает река-приносит много мусора. ownerResponse/text:
We are sorry for your bad experience at the hotel. You are aware that you arrived around midnight during a storm. This is the monsoon period, and we sometimes experience stormy weather. During these storms, the resort looks in disarray, with plenty of fallen leaves littering the garden and the swimming pool. This would have been your first impression. We had arranged a housekeeping supervisor on duty to show you to the room on arrival without delay.
At departure, you had written on the guest registration card that you were not happy with the ambiance nor the cleanliness of the room but found the bed comfortable. 
We are sorry you did not stay longer at the resort to really experience it and find your hurried judgment unjustifiable. We have a system that all rooms are checked prior to release and this ensures that all linen are in good condition and the room is properly cleaned and the bathroom works properly. If you had issues to the contrary like the towels and flow of water, this could have been intimated at checkout.
We hope you will visit us to see and experience the hotel, which we are sure will change your judgment, which is misleading to other readers.
placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Doesn’t look like the pictures on their website.
text:
-Booked Aqua room that has a private pool, and the room looked nothing like it was on the website which probably has pictures from the time the hotel was built possibly. They were truly misleading

- Airport transfer was arranged as planned through another company and it was on time and comfortable.

- We were arriving later than midnight on the first night of the booking and this was informed to the property. Who assured that someone will be available to greet us. No duty manager was available and a service staff escorted us to the room saying can check in the morning after 7.30 am.

-The room was dirty, no fire alarm, washed out, mould, even a moth was hovering around.

-The towels were so old with strings hanging out.

-Hot water didn’t work and the water was clogging not draining.

- The jacuzzi was outdated yellowish.

-The back door was not sealing and locking properly.

- As it was middle of the night we decided to nap for a few hours and early 7.30 we went down to the reception to request for a check out.

- The staff were friendly however oblivious to the current state of the property. He offered us different room, and it was not any better.

- The cherry on the top was we were asked to pay for that one night (the few hours we spent from Midnight till 7AM). 

-We paid and just got out of the place as fast as we could.

-The location is amazing right at the beach. But neglected by the management and the staff are hospitable and helpful, smily but need hospitality training.
title: Washed out, poorly maintained property

ownerResponse/text: We are sorry you were not satisfied with your stay. Unfortunately, on rainy days water flows into the sea from the famous Kogalla lagoon. Please note this happens only during the rainy periods and during dry periods the flow of water stops. We have trained staff who continuously clean the beach to ensure guests could use the beach.
placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text: Awful private beach. Very dirty water with a lot of sand. If you are looking for a nice private beach don’t even think about cocobay hotel. Breakfast is very poor. You don’t get the value for the money paid. The hotel is overpriced
title: Awful private beach

ownerResponse/text:
We have taken your comments into serious consideration and have done a thorough investigation on all points mentioned by you.
All the negative points mentioned in your review were not reported during your stay. Your stay for 1 night was during the peak December period and we can assure you that we had all corners covered to ensure the highest standards were offered to our guests as we were running at full capacity daily. We had sufficient stocks of food and beverage to ensure that all our menus on offer were supplied to the complete satisfaction of all of our guests. TV, plug points, AC, mini bar, and all other equipment are checked and documented prior to checking in guests. If anything was not working, you could have reported this at the time as we have an in-house maintenance team to fix such issues. However, not a single complaint had been made by you during your stay. Staff professionalism is of paramount importance to us and you can see that this is confirmed by the positive remarks made by other guest reviews.
Our investigations revealed that you were really disappointed that you lost your handsfree. Our staff did their utmost but could not find it. We are sorry you lost this but it is a large area including the beach.
All in all, we are sorry you lost your handsfree and still hope you will visit us again.
placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for one night with friends and the location seems to be cozy.. the room was poorly maintained and half of the plug points including the TV wasn’t working.. so we had issues even to use the kettle.. the doors were rusted and locks weren’t working properly.. 

The restaurant served food which was half of what was mentioned in the menu.. and the staff was too slow and did no even bother with our choices.. what was shocking was that one staff member even randomly came to us and asked for a cigarette which we felt bad and offered.. which showed us the levels of professionalism in the place.. 

On top of all when we had left a handsfree in the room and went to check back the hotel was reluctant to send us back to the room and by the time we checked the entire room was upside down (assuming for cleaning) and it was not there to be found ..  there was no attempt made to check if it’s there and they constantly denied it wasn’t there.. 

We were excited to stay after checking the reviews and after our stay we leave with regret that we stayed here..
title: Poorly maintained property with bad service

ownerResponse/text: It is sad to get such a malicious and false review. It is stated that the beach is next to a sewage pipe. This is totally false and can cause irreparable damage to all the businesses in the bay. During rainy periods a stream from the famous Kogalla lake flows to the sea close to the hotel. This happens a few times during the monsoon period. During the dry season from December to May, the stream does not flow into the sea. It is only during times of heavy rain that the beach turns brown but the beach is quickly cleaned by the staff and can be used as normal. Please note that there is no sewage flow to the sea as the authorities control the bay and beach since it is a designated wildlife and beach sanctuary. The writer is entitled to his opinion on other matters which are in contrary to almost all the other reviews written by guests. The current pictures are exactly as the hotel looks and can be verified by any visiting guest.
placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
the water is Brown after rainy days because its next to a sweage pipe.

the service is great very very nice staff.
beds are comfortable but just wanted to leave asap.

i do not recommend this place and the pics on the website look great but not the reality of this sad brown beach and ugly hotel.

text: I was expecting an amazing hotel for the price I paid and was so disappointed. There was a lack of toiletries in the room.
