placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: I recommend you go there & stay one day then pay for the rest of your holiday.Unawatuna has a beautiful resort with luxury experience.
text:
On our visit to Sri Lanka we stayed at 3properties, this was by distance the weakest but the most expensive one.
To be accurate it was the worst property we visited ever.It was more like a little guest house not a hotel;definitely not 5star hotel.
We had bookings for 4 nights but couldn’t complete our stay and left soon after we found a beautiful,luxurious resort in the unawatuna main beach road for half the price we paid in coco bay.
Positive point is only seafood was delicious others than that everything was awful.
-They didn’t have enough dishes or cutlery of the same to serve few tables although they are open to the public as a restaurant.
-Room was absolutely dated,rusted and moulded .
Black mould all over the bathroom curtain and the mattress protection sheet and pillows , bed smelled puke.
Awful beach towels, poor beach equipments all old and broken,poor maintenance of the pool although it’s very small.
Extremely small beach area looks private although it’s not but because it’s not in the popular area no one goes there otherwise it’s not private.
The beach is black and muddy rather than sand.
Overall.
All the photos you see on the booking websites are belong to 9years ago when they got everything new.
title: Terrible Experience

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text: On our trip to SL we visited 6 properties, this was by some distance the weakest. The idea of a fixed menu was a good idea poorly executed. My advice is use either Jetwings or Cinnamon Lodge which are a proper 5 star experience.
title: disappointed

ownerResponse/text:
We are sorry that your stay with us was not a happy one as you felt you were overcharged.
This is the peak of the season and hence  the highest rates for the year are applied which is normal for beach side hotels. Our rates for a double on Half board ,including b'fast and dinner varies between USD 300 to USD 400 per day during this peak which is for 3 weeks.
Thereafter the prices drop and are discounted by as much as 40%.
You booked one of our most expensive suites on double occupancy on Half board basis.
However on arrival , you checked in 2 adults and 3 kids. Our kids policy and charge for extra beds are clearly stated on the website. When our FO staff mentioned this fact and that we would have to charge only half price for the kids meals and for 1 extra bed ,you were clearly unhappy . This is normal hotel policies around the world and clearly mentioned on our web site.
We waived off the charge for the extra bed and you may have noticed that the kids meals were made to order and served accordingly. 
We have a high rate of approval from most of our guests  appreciate the standard , location and services offered by the resort.
placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
I made my booking directly via their website and was clearly expecting more. I paid 4 times less for same standards hotels during the rest of my trip. Only the restaurant (half board) was fully satisfying. 

The location of the hotel is nice also (private beach, just a few km from Galle fort) but can’t justify itself the price I was asked. Which was abominably expensive. I had the opportunity to share my concerns with the on duty Manager who proposed me to discuss within the Hotel Managing Director but he never made himself available to discuss despite he was in the Hotel during my stay. Very unfortunate.

For 400usd/ night you expect to stay in a proper 5 stars hotels with high standards everywhere. Except the restaurant it was far to be the case.

I will recommend this hotel with pleasure only when they will have aligned to the market and positioned differently.

A frustrating stay at the end of fantastic family holidays - whereas it was supposed to be the summit of our trip given what we paid, before returning to our country.
title: Nice but abominably expensive....

ownerResponse/text:
This message is a bit confusing. The closest airport is in Colombo which is more than 150 kms away.
We are sorry you did not convey to any of our staff of any problems you did encounter during your stay.
We are nevertheless sorry you did not enjoy your stay with us
placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text: Near the hotel (260meter accoding to Google map) there is Cement factory. The airport in the hotel espesially in the nigth are very unclean and bad. Our children where sleeping and wake up several times per night.
title: Some photos about Coco Bay Hotel Unawatuna

ownerResponse/text:
We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay with us. 
As in any hotel we do have a check out time and the butlers and reception staff inquire from guests what time they will be checking out to make it a smooth check out and be available for baggage down service at the designated time without the guests having to phone the reception.
The swimming pool is always maintained properly and clean. Not a single of the many ,many guests who have stayed here have complained the pool was not clean.
We have only 16 rooms/ suites and hence provide a small gym which cannot be compared to a large gym available at a big hotel.
We are sorry you did not appreciate the location which is one of our strongest attractions having a semi private beach in a quiet bay away from the hustle and bustle of the main Unawatuna strip and Galle town.
Perhaps you chose the wrong hotel as most of our clients choose the COCO BAY to enjoy a peaceful ,hassle free holiday in a quiet environment.
We are sorry you had a bad experience with one of the butlers and will immidiately look into this.
placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
We were visiting Sri Lanka for a week and read good things about beach at Unawatuna. And it turned out to be a good 2 day ocean side experience.

But CoCoBay Hotel was not part of it. 

1st, the location is awkward, it's in between the Galle Fort Old Town and Unawatuna main beach. So we need to take tuktuk to "fun places". 

2nd, for the rate we got, way over priced. The room was ok, but it's got an early 2000 feeling. Hotel facilities were very poor. Lobby is small and heavily windy, gym is a joke, pool is not very clean. 

3rd, service was all over the place. One doorman was really nice and informative. One housekeeping guy was rude and impolite. The guy asked us three times when to check out on our last night of stay. And literally said that " I need to know your time so I can clean the room". Then on the following day, punctually knocked on our door at 12 noon, walked into our room, and started moving our luggages outside. Unbelievable. 

Anyway, do go to Galle/Unawatuna, but stay away from CoCoBay Hotel
title: Soooo over rated / priced

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
I have just written a great review early on regarding my experience when i went for a lunch with my family. After this, i want it to come back on our last day and spend the day in this beatifull and classy hotel. 

When we arrived the kids were very happy as we were doing some sort of tuck tuck racing. The "manager" came out and said to my wife that you should control your kids, we apologised, but his reply was that if we wanted to stay we should control our kids behavior. I have travelled the world and never got this rubbish! 

Please avoid visiting this hotel if you have "fun loving" children.
title: "Noisy kids not welcome"

ownerResponse/text:
We regret the misleading comment on diesel fumes. Fogging is carried out against mosquitoes regularly and this is done in most hotels in the tropics as a prevention against disease caused by mosquito bites.
On days when fumigation is carried a notice is displayed in each and every room as well as a prominent notice at the front desk informing all our guests accordingly.
Our butlers and the receptionists too inform our guests verbally.
This is the normal procedure adopted at hotels and we are sorry you missed this notice and were inconvenienced.
placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text: Food ok, expensive. We and several other guests sat in the restaurant when they started spraying diesel (mosquito control) in garden. The whole place quickly filled up with diesel fumes and we had to get out quickly, especially as we had our baby with us. Don't know why they would do this without even warning people first, giving us a chance to leave.
title: Diesel fumes

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Rooms upstairs
text:
Roomassala is one of the magical places along the south coast and going back decades we used to camp out on this very same beach and on jungle beach.. so when a friend of mine mentioned of Coco Bay I thought you cannot go far wrong. 

Rating is poor at best due to a multitude of things...... 

We thought the staff were top notch... very endearing and always with a smile willing to go the extra mile.... This and the alcove beach are the real attractions and winner of this place..... Venture a bit further to jungle beach on the next bend and you will find a tad better beach. 

Rooms - Extremely spacious, has the required trappings etc. AC's don't work properly. Jacuzi cannot be used as the power trips out. The finishing touches are cheap for the price tag of the hotel. Door and windows dont close / seal properly which means the AC cannot function at its best. A pity as the rooms have the potential to command and create some real awe,,,

Food - For an al la catre menu poor quantity (its not a epicurean) and more importantly quality.  Only exception was the traditional SL breakfast.... At dinner prawns were flaky (which means it was old), baked crab was tangy..did not venture too far into the meal as we were both not too confident. English breakfast had one measly wrinkled sausage which was obviously taken straight out of the freezer. tenderloin was more bone.... if you are pricing for exclusivity guests need to be given quality,. 
There are quite a few like minded places who get the little things right.... 

We ended up doing  quick run to Galle fort and Hiks for some stunning meals.... this should not be the case as guests expect a degree of quality.

Hotel is still in its infancy so there is room to develop.... but at circa $300 ++ per night you are looking at places that offer seriously much better value and quality on an overall basis.... 

I am surprised considering the people behind this project are no slouches in the trade having previously been part of some successful ventures... However, it lacks the exclusive panache and touches that is expected with such a price tag. Again drawing paraleels to places along the coastal belt that prices itself between $200 upwards.... 

As initially alluded the place does have potential and most importantly they have the staff with the right attitude,,,,,,, but I believe there is poor direction and attention to detail from management. In my books this is no more than a $150 -175 until such time things are put in place. 

Will find it difficult to recommend.. considering all the great options not too far away.
title: A place with lots of potential.... but falls short of its price tag

ownerResponse/text: We are extremely sorry for this misunderstanding. At your request I personally sent your driver off after you explained the problems you had with him. Neither myself nor my staff have had any contact with this driver thereafter. We are extremely sorry that you think bad of the resort due to something that was not done by us and this has spoilt the memory of your stay with us.
placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
Spent 3 nights at this hotel at the end of our trip to Sri Lanka in May 2013.

The hotel itself is very nice, good rooms, nice bath rooms, nice views and is located in the beginning of Unawatuna close to Galle Fort (a 10 minute tuk tuk ride away). There isn't much of a beach around the hotel, and the area behind the hotel has some litter. 

The staff at the hotel were friendly and accommodated a request for a birthday cake making my husbands birthday quite special and we came back to towel elephants on our bed and a message saying 'happy birthday' which was quite sweet.

We left Coco Bay feeling that we had salvaged some of our holiday which we had struggled to enjoy due to the services of a tour company called Flywing tours and their driver Jegan whom we had dismissed on our drop off to this hotel due to his dishonesty, attempts to con us and his very dangerous driving. 

However it seems (from a number of abusive messages later sent to us by the driver following his dismissal by us) that he had been informed by the staff at this hotel that we had had problems with our credit card (a forgotten pin so we used a different account card) and didn't have cash to pay for our stay (a complete and utter lie). This detail, albeit incorrect, could only have come from the hotel staff who were around when we were paying our bill and checking out.

We really can't understand why the staff at Coco Bay would do this, especially after we confided in the manager Reny our concerns about this driver and even showed him the abusive text message that was sent to us. He told us not to worry and took down the drivers telephone number and company details and assured us that the hotel was secure and that we should enjoy the rest of our holiday. We trusted him and the other staff and cannot understand why they would go behind our backs and say these things to this driver who they knew there was clearly a problem with. We feel really betrayed.

I can only say that we are really disappointed that what we thought was the best hotel of our trip has actually turned out to be the worst because of their actions.
title: Coco bay - good hotel but betrayed by staff

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Chandima,

Thank you for your review following your recent visit to Flavoured.

We sincerely regret the experience you encountered during your dinner reservation. Please accept our apologies for the inconvenience caused due to the table arrangement and the service interaction. This is not reflective of the standards we aim to maintain.

Our Restaurant Manager has spoken with you upon reviewing your feedback, and your concerns have been taken seriously. The matter has been addressed with the relevant team members to ensure such situations are avoided in the future.

We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back and better serve you.

Best wishes!
placeInfo/address: 59 Ananda Coomaraswamy Mawatha, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: Went to Flavored restaurant for dinner buffet 25th June. We booked in advance and paid half of the total cost to book a table for 10. When we went restaurant was packed and we didn’t have a table reserved!! Waiters there said another group sat on our already reserved table so they will prepare another table and give us. The whole concept of reservation is that customers don’t have to wait. Eranga who came to us with a massive attitude saying why can’t you’ll wait for 5 minutes and asked me not to make a scene and keep quiet. Very disappointed about the customer service and how we were treated when it’s their fault not reserving a table after paying for it. Management should train their staff on how to talk to customers. People like Eranga should be trained to respect customers and how to talk.
title: Poor customer service

ownerResponse/text:

Regarding the delay during check-out, we’re sorry for the inconvenience you faced and appreciate your patience. Your comments will be reviewed with the relevant teams for better responsiveness in the future.

text: Security officer could have been more polite and checkout could have been more efficient. she should have realised our  urgecny( after tellin it). She could have explaind the reason for delay at least.
title: Rude security officer and slow checkout

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sasanka,

Thank you for your review following your recent visit.

We regret to hear that your experience did not meet your expectations and would like to address your concerns.

Kindly note that we have conducted a detailed internal review, including checking CCTV footage and staff records. Our findings indicate the following

•	Check-in Experience: Contrary to your statement, no guests were seen cutting the line or being prioritized. Your check-in process took 12 minutes, and the delay was solely due to a missing identification document from your group, which was later resolved with a digital passport copy.
•	Recheck-in and room availability: At no point were you informed that the hotel was fully occupied. Your rebooking was successfully made via our online platform at 09:00 hrs, and our team began assisting you upon your arrival at 10:00 hrs. CCTV footage confirms a 17-minute recheck-in process with no other guests at the counter during that time. However, we acknowledge that the process may not have felt as seamless as expected, and we regret any frustration this may have caused. 
•	Room cleaning: We regret if our housekeeping interaction felt unprofessional and will follow up with the relevant team to ensure improved communication going forward.  
•	Food delivery: Please note that, as an operational procedure, we do not handle outside food deliveries due to health and safety reasons. Guests are required to collect such orders from the entrance. We apologize if this caused any inconvenience.

At Cinnamon Red, we take every concern seriously, but we also stand by our team when the facts and documentation do not support the allegations made. It is disheartening to see a review written with such harshness, particularly when many of the claims are not substantiated.

Nonetheless, your feedback has been noted and shared with senior management.

Best wishes!
placeInfo/address: 59 Ananda Coomaraswamy Mawatha, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Service was really poor. Rude service.
text:
I’m honestly furious with how badly this hotel has gone downhill. I used to rate it 5 stars. I used to recommend it to friends and family. But after this recent stay, I’ll never come back — and I hope management takes this seriously because things are falling apart fast.

To the management:
You desperately need to retrain your staff. Whatever standards you once had are clearly gone. Hospitality isn’t just about rooms — it’s about respect, service, and care. Right now, none of that exists here.

Let me break down the four situations that made my stay a complete nightmare:

1. Check-in was a disaster.
It was slow, disorganized, and beyond frustrating. I waited for ages while others cut the line with the staff just ignoring it. It set the tone for what turned out to be an awful stay.

2. Lied to about room availability.
I asked to extend my stay — they told me the hotel was full. Turns out, that was a lie. I checked online right there and booked a room from their own site. When I showed this, they gave me the runaround, wasting my time and acting like they were doing me a favor. Unbelievable.

3. Rude and unprofessional housekeeping.
When I requested cleaning the next morning, the cleaner showed up and started interrogating me about when I checked in and why the room needed cleaning again. Then he blamed the reception team like it was my fault. I’m here to rest, not get caught in your internal mess.

4. Food delivery drama.
I ordered food via Uber Eats, and the driver brought it to the entrance. I asked the staff to collect it from reception — totally normal, right? Nope. The outside crew refused to even let the driver park. One staff member, Manohara, insisted the driver just wait until I came downstairs. Even after I made it crystal clear to just take the delivery, the way they treated the driver — and me — was downright rude and dismissive.

I’m angry. I’m disappointed. I’m done with this place.
This hotel used to feel welcoming — now it just feels like a joke. If anyone in management actually cares, fix this. Fast.
title: Getting Worst

text:
Used to be a perennial favourite of ours, but this visit of 3 nights was terrible. We were first given the card of the wrong room and walked into someone showering. The second card they gave to a different room didn't work and we had to make our way back to the lobby once more to get it validated. This card promptly stopped working the next evening, leaving us stuck outside our room, tired and with baggage after work. The next day housekeeping had broken our shower head and we had water spray all over when we turned it on.
All these were fixed within 10 to 15 minutes. But the sheer load of issues, along with the slightly run down look of the rooms made us realise that they don't really care about customer experience any more.. they have enough business coming in to AFFORD inattention to detail.
So next time, we'll stay someplace else.
Thanks for the visits over the past years though, on earlier occasions we have found the staff, service and rooms all perfect.
title: Yet another review that won't change this shitfest

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Deshan,
Thank you for sharing your feedback. We’d like to address your concerns directly.
Cinnamon Red Colombo operates as a lean luxury hotel, so welcome drinks are not part of our offerings, but we appreciate your suggestion. We regret the buffet didn’t meet your expectations, and your comments have been shared with our culinary team.
We acknowledge that our bathroom doors are unlockable by design and regret any inconvenience this may have caused.
The safety locker was replaced promptly upon request. Regarding the TV, our technician noted an issue with the sound and offered to replace the HDMI cable, though we understand you preferred to delay the repair.
We apologize for the check-in delay and have shared your feedback with our front office team to improve this process. For the key card, as indicated on the card itself, it’s valid only during your stay, and reactivation is required for any extended time.
Further, we regret that the futon couch we offered didn’t meet your comfort standards. Additionally, two complimentary water bottles are provided per room, with extra bottles available at a small charge.
We’re glad you enjoyed the view from the 22nd floor and thank you for your valuable feedback—it helps us improve our guest experience.
Best Wishes!
placeInfo/address: 59 Ananda Coomaraswamy Mawatha, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
roomTip: This hotel only suitable for couples or nudist 😂😂
text:
Very disappointed. Terrible experience. Will never visit again! This might be my last stay at a Cinnamon hotel.

This is my third experience with Cinnamon hotels. Previously, I stayed at Cinnamon Citadel Kandy (2021) and Cinnamon Bey Beruwala (2024). This was my 8th hotel stay this year (2024). The other hotels I stayed at this year were Jetwing Lake Dambulla (March 2024), Cinnamon Bey Beruwala (June 2024), Turyaa Kalutara (July 2024), Golden Ridge Nuwara Eliya (October 2024), Heritance Ahungalle (October 2024), Earl's Regency Kandy (October 2024), Cinnamon Red (October 2024), and Citrus Waskaduwa (scheduled for November 2024, which will be my third stay).

Previously, I had positive experiences at Cinnamon Bey Beruwala, and Cinnamon Red has a stunning view, which is why I chose this hotel over Marino Beach or Taj Samudra. The budget or price wasn't an issue, as I typically avoid hotels below 4 stars. Before booking, I knew this was a 3-star hotel, but I assumed it had that rating due to the smaller rooms (26m²). I wasn’t sure how hotel ratings work, but I thought it might still be a decent choice. I was wrong. In my opinion, this hotel doesn't even deserve 2 stars.

Here’s what went wrong:

1. No welcome drinks: I asked the reception why they don’t offer welcome drinks to in-house guests, and they said, “This is a budget and business hotel.” That’s not a proper excuse—welcome drinks don’t cost much and are a nice gesture for guests. Even hotels without star ratings offer welcome drinks.

2. Poor buffet spread: The buffet was very minimal, almost like a mini buffet. For Rs. 6,000 per dinner, it was a waste of money. You can get a much better spread at other hotels in Colombo. To me, it wasn't worth more than Rs. 3,500 due to the lack of variety.

3. No bathroom door locks: This was unbelievable. It might be fine for couples, but this hotel doesn’t only accommodate couples—families and friends stay here too. We’re not nudists or aborigines! We had to use a bathroom on a different floor. How can they not have locks on bathroom doors?

4. Faulty safety locker and TV: The room’s safety locker didn’t work, and we had to wait 20 minutes for it to be replaced. The TV had no sound, and while they offered to fix it by replacing a cable, we declined since we didn’t want to waste more time. Why aren’t these things checked before guests check in?

5. Delayed check-in: Check-in was supposed to be at 2 P.M., but we had to wait over 40 minutes for our room.

6. Late checkout issue: We requested a 1-hour late checkout since the reception wasted our time during check-in, and they agreed. However, our room key stopped working after 12:00 P.M., and I had to go back to reception to reactivate it.

7. Terrible extra bed: The extra bed felt like a coffin—extremely uncomfortable.

8. No free extra water bottles: They don’t even provide extra water bottles for free

Actually in this my review i gave 2 star over 1 star because they give me a 22nd floor room. If not this would be 1 star rating
title: Very disappointed

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Harneet,
Thank you for providing feedback on your recent stay at Cinnamon Red Colombo. 
Upon careful investigation of the issues you raised, we would like to provide some clarification.
Upon review of the check-in, it was noted that you arrived before the standard check-in time. Despite this, our Front Office staff made arrangements to accommodate your early arrival. Both rooms were ready by 12:23 PM, and our staff even ensured that the rooms were next to each other. Additionally, you expressed gratitude for the complimentary early check-in.
Regarding the calculation issue during your check-out, our records revealed that there was no error made by our staff. You had initially booked two single rooms on a bed-and-breakfast basis, when the requirement was for two rooms for four persons. Upon arrival, you disputed this and claimed to have reserved two double rooms instead. Our Front office staff member promptly showed you the booking details, which clearly indicated the pax count selected during the reservation process. After reviewing the information provided, you acknowledged the error on your part and agreed to pay for the additional breakfast on consumption, which was amicably agreed. You had also requested a complimentary breakfast for the two additional persons which we politely declined.
Furthermore, during your check-out, there was no miscalculation in the charges presented to you. Our team clearly outlined the total amount due, including applicable taxes, in both USD and LKR currencies. It was explained to you that an additional SSC tax would be incurred if payment was to be made in LKR. The additional tax (SSC) is imposed as per the regulations of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka.  However, this too was waived on your request. 
Upon checkout, you demanded that you are entitled to a balance payment of LKR 119.85, since you had previously settled the bill in USD and then made a balance payment of LKR 15,000. Initially, you informed the associate who checked you in that you didn’t want the balance amount. This was, however, refunded back to you.
Further, you had not requested to speak to a manager at checkout; instead, you had mentioned to the associate that you had communicated the above refund to the manager upon arrival, which you had not. You claim that the Manager was standing in a corner smiling. We see no harm in that, as he was interacting with other guests. 
In response to your comments about the food quality, we regret that it did not meet your expectations.
Your review portrays the hotel and staff in a poor light, whereas we have gone the extra mile to accommodate the many requests you had, from a complimentary early check-in, to waiving the additional tax. We acknowledge though that as a customer, it is your privilege to review us as you deem fit. 
Regards !

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Jeshan,
Thank you for providing feedback on your recent stay at Cinnamon Red. We appreciate your time and want to address the concerns you have raised.
In reference to the incident at the reception, we would like to clarify that our operational procedures regarding foreign currency are strictly dictated by Central Bank regulations. The rejection of the 20-dollar note and the inability to provide change for the 100-dollar note were in compliance with these regulations, and our Front Office Associate did her best to explain this.
The option to withdraw money from an ATM or visit a licensed commercial bank for currency exchange was presented as an alternative, as we are unable to bypass the strict foreign currency regulations enforced by the Government of Sri Lanka. Additionally, the information about the additional tax when paying in LKR was shared in adherence to the country's regulations, not as an attempt to inconvenience you.
Regarding the incident with the insect in the breakfast packet, we take matters of hygiene seriously and sincerely apologize for this. Our team has thoroughly investigated the matter and is reinforcing our already stringent procedures to prevent any such incidents in the future.
Your feedback is invaluable as we continually strive to enhance our guest experience. We hope you understand the challenges we face due to external regulations and appreciate your consideration.
Best regards!
placeInfo/address: 59 Ananda Coomaraswamy Mawatha, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
I recently completed my third stay at Cinnamon Red this year, and regrettably, I've observed a decline in the quality of service, particularly at the reception. The reception team, who should serve as the face of the hotel, lacked a warm welcome and failed to provide a positive experience.

During my six-night stay, I encountered an unpleasant incident with Miss Dulasha at the reception including her manager. Despite an initially pleasant interaction, issues arose when I attempted to pay in USD. A 20-dollar note with a minor pen mark was rejected, and later, when I requested change for a 100-dollar note, they claimed Central Bank requirements prevented them from providing change in dollars.

After a frustrating 45-minute ordeal, during which they refused to give change for USD and attempted to charge an additional 2.5% fee for paying in LKR, I resorted to using my credit card, incurring extra currency transaction fees. This experience left us feeling discriminated against, as if our nationality affected the level of respect we received.

Additionally, a disappointing incident occurred during check-out when I discovered a cockroach in one of the breakfast boxes I had requested. Despite reporting it to the hotel immediately, this added to the overall dissatisfaction of my stay.

While the rooms were commendable, credit goes to the diligent room boy, S S Dilakshan. I sincerely hope that this feedback reaches the appropriate channels at Cinnamon Red. The decline in service quality is disheartening, and I believe investing in effective hospitality management for the reception team could significantly improve the overall experience. Best wishes to Cinnamon Red in addressing these concerns and maintaining the high standards expected from the Cinnamon Hotel chain.
title: Disappointing Experience

Regards!

text: I experienced a very unpleasant incident while I was in the process of checking at the level 7 check in counter. The staff was not polite and seems like never trained for customer handling. There were two persons name Sulakshana and another trainee guy, even do not have basic ethics to talk to the customer. This girl told me indirectly whether you take what we allocated or leave. I was really wondering whether this hotel is under the same Cinnamon Group from such rude behavior from the staff compared to all other cinnamon hotel where we receive fantastic service all the times.
title: Terrible Front Office Experience

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Think of it as Very expensive camping
text: The place is wonderful, the people are wonderful and the food is wonderful but there’s a massive floor in the details. The rooms are all built so that they are naturally ventilated which means there is no soundproofing whatsoever and it’s very very difficult to sleep. I find it incredibly ironic that I paid to come on a wellness package as I was suffering from insomnia and left feeling really unwell.
title: Sleep is impossible

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
I stayed at this hotel in 2019, and at the time, I had a much better experience than I did now. Unfortunately, despite the significant price increase (150% more), the quality has dropped considerably. For a hotel that advertises itself as a wellness destination, the environment does not provide the tranquility one would expect. The constant noise from the restaurant, both from the kitchen and the staff, made the experience unpleasant. Additionally, disturbances caused by guests in the next room during the evening and by the staff early in the morning further disrupted the sense of relaxation.

Another negative aspect was the internet, which was extremely slow—something unacceptable for a hotel charging 800 euros per night. The cleanliness was also subpar, with the room windows, both top and bottom, visibly dirty. To make matters worse, at the restaurant, we were asked to keep the cutlery between courses, which is not appropriate for a service of this standard.

Overall, the hotel seems to have lost focus on customer experience and the essence of a wellness retreat. I do not recommend staying here until these issues are addressed, especially given the high cost.
title: Not worth the money paid

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text: Be careful booking here! They advertised A/C when we booked, but then they don’t actually have A/C in the rooms. And there are bugs that come into the room in the evening. The Garden View Chalets are a complete waste of money since there’s no view and it’s far from the main area. They also don’t tell you to book a spa booking in advance if you don’t book direct, so it’s fully booked when you show up.
title: Be Careful When Booking

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
This is the biggest disappointment of Sri Lanka.

I have visited many beautiful hotels in my life all over the world as I love boutique hotels and unique architectural projects. 
I was very excited to visit Santani as I heard a lot about it.

Well…. My conclusion was that this hotel is totally overrated and insanely overpriced for what you get!

I had very high expectations after reading all the reviews and especially after paying so much money when booking through my travel agent.

I was supposed to stay 4 nights as I came to rest but very quickly after my arrival I felt I would not stay the full time. The reason:
My very loud and noisy room!

After a very messy and totally inappropriate arrival (road was obstructed and we needed to change car and tuk tuk twice) I was brought to my room, a “garden view Room “ at the end of a dark road near very dense bushes. There was absolutely no garden to see but very wild and densely packed vegetation.

The bungalow with the “garden rooms “is very isolated and has absolutely no garden view. They are located in a very dark area noisy spot without light and air, 7-8min walk from the main buiding. Rooms are very close to eachother. They are totally open allaround it: no walls till the ceiling: so EXTREMELY NOISY! 

The rooms have absolutely no charm and comfort (very dark, no AC, no air, no tv, no view). The bathroom also is extremely basic and not very clean.

The night came and I immediately noticed the room was very very noisy due to the proximity of the dense bushes all around. Also the sound of the neighbours including flushing toilets, sound of conversations and staff talking nearby was heard extremely well from room to room.
No privacy possible when all neighbours can hear eachother. 

Obviously with decibels reaching easily the sound of traffic (between 60-90 decibels) I could not sleep at all that first night. Especially the frogs, birds and various insects were EXTREMELY LOUD and agitated.
You can literally hear the same way as if you would sleep in a tent in the middle of the jungle.

I was expecting a very quiet and nice experience instead it was a nightmare and stressy experience: a sleepless agitated night.

Also my room was at the end of a very dark and scary muddy road, without sufficient lighting. Very challenging to reach especially in the dark after dinner.

This made my experience not enjoyable at all.

I spoke about the sleeping issue to the staff but they were totally unhelpful, telling me they will get back to me. 

After 2 horrible night, without any sleep, I begged the staff to find a solution but they were extremely unfriendly and unhelpful. They did not get back to me. Only After 2 nights adressing the noise problem, they told me I had to address the issue to my travel agent which I did immediately.

I got informed that they would not do anything about the problem and that the open rooms was part of the concept of the hotel to have open rooms with the sound of Nature. 
They could upgrade me to a more silent room (mountain view) but with paying surcharge and only for 1 night, next night I would have had to change again to the initial Garden View Room.

As I was very upset not having slept 2 nights in a row, I decided I could not have another 2 sleepless nights. 
As the manager didn’t want to help I decided to leave the property and check out from the hotel.

Having stayed 2 nights only instead of 4 they refused to reimburse my last 2 nights. So basically I lost the 2 last nights without reimbursement (more then 700$ lost).

About the rest of the hotel:
Restaurant
I went for dinner several times as it is included in the package: full pension.
During my first meal they forgot to ask what I wanted to drink (my drink was served after I finished my meal). It happened a few times again.

The meal came after 3min I sat down. I chose the Sri Lankan menu which all came together. Food was very good but I finished my meal and the entire meal took about 15-20 minutes. 
It is not a very cosy moment. Everything is served very quick and they don’t take the time to make it a long lasting experience.
They don’t ask you for example if you still want something after the desert.
It felt each time very expedited, like it had to go very quick: you come you go as fast as possible. Maximum time I was there was 20- 25minutes. 
The food was very good, unfortunately the fish was not very well cooked.
But in general the food is excellent.

Architecture 
Very beautiful main building. Too bad the groundfloor is not very cosy: I wanted to sit to read a book but also very loud because of the wood floor from the restaurant.

Garden maintenance is not very well taken care of.

Swimming pool area is very bad: nobody is there (no staff): no towels are given, no possibility to order drinks or food. When I arrived every chair was left with used towels from previous guests. I didn’t know if I could use a chair as they were all used.
I stayed at least 1,5 hour and didn’t see any staff in that time.
This is not what you expect from this type of hotel.

Welness: 
Is a joke,
I wanted to book a session but there was no available place for the next 48hours.
I only did the yoga class which was OK. 
I also used the sauna/ hammam. Unfortunately there was nobody there to explain and guide me. Also the hammam was not switched on. 
The welness area is OK but locker rooms need to be refurbished. Also view is not really special. You just look on a plain grass level.

I wanted to book some activities but they were totally overpriced.

My stay at the Santani was not memorable and ended in tears. 

I would definitely not recommend this hotel as I have visited so many amazing places in Sri Lanka.
title: Biggest disappointment in Sri Lanka

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Carlotta, 

I want to thank you for staying with us in the first place and thank you for your feedback. We are extremely sorry that your stay did not meet your expectations. We have thrived in taking care of our guests as you can see from almost all the reviews we have had so far and the five star rating we have maintained over 5 year and we are very sorry and disappointed that you did not feel the same way. 

We acknowledge the facts around the PCR test and we could not deliver the PCR test at the resort as we normally do. (which is the normal practice)

However, it would be pertinent if we all have a bit more understanding in these extra-ordinary days for travel. There is no certainty when you are travelling these days with sudden onset of the variants, regulations, travel restrictions etc and we have to be prepared for few hiccups if its genuine. As it has happened, the test was scheduled but the whole team from the 3rd party lab that was operating the mobile testing unit had tested positive for Omicron and that is why they were not able to come to the resort. There were no other options but to go to the lab to get the tests done. Its not that we didn't want to work with you to get a better solution. However, as you have mentioned, we didn't even charge for the drive to Kandy.

I wanted to highlight few other facts from your review as well. 

1. We are located 34KM from Kandy and its about 1 hour to 1 hour 10 min drive. 
2. The road is in excellent condition and paved to highway standards all the way to the estate. Within the estate its paved as well.
3. There is no risky behaviour with drivers that is different to anywhere else in the island. Its the same drivers who drive tourist around the country. 
4. All mountain view rooms have a similar view. 

Thank you.
placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
I have spent two nights in Santani and I have been disappointed by the management and its response to a few challenges over my stay. 

Starting with a few positive notes: the restaurant staff is attentive and has represented the best part of our stay. The food is yummy with a fixed menu and two choices per meal. The spa facility (free of charge) is nice and complementary free actives available. The pool area is nice and the view incredible at sunset. 

A few points for improvement are related to the branding of bungalows as Mountain View as the one we have been provided was facing a different view (less spectacular) for the same price. 

Negative points: while I have requested a PCR test on February 4th by email on top of various requests and forms shared to the Management (allergies, flight schedule) our PCR was not booked and the day prior to our travel we had to reach Kandy (3 hours return trip) as this or an early travel to Colombo were the only option put on the table. The management was totally dismissive of my complaint and while acknowledging the reception of a complaint email never responded or addressed the issue and request for compensation. This means that we have skipped all complementary free of charge activities to perform a PCR test booked almost a month before. The transfer fee to Kandy were then not charged by the hotel but this represents a min compensation and the lack of acknowledgment from management a breach in hospitality protocol considering the rating of the hotel. 

The facility is situated 1 hour and a half from Kandy. The road is bad and unsafe and drivers are often adopting risky behavior at turns. This shall be flagged in their website. 

All in all, the location so out of hand and the services provided do not justify a 5 star rating nor prices in Sri Lanka. I would suggest to skip your stay and invest money in other structure in Sri Lanka where we had exquisite stay for half the price and much more attentive management. Hospitality is also looking at challenges together with the client and find optimal solutions. Not closing a blind eye linked to positive ratings.
title: Disappointing stay and poor management

ownerResponse/text:
Dear FC&OV,   

Firstly, we have to assume that you may have mixed up your Sri Lanka and Indonesia trip, as Nasi Goreng is not the National dish of Sri Lanka, but a very popular and very unhealthy street food item in Indonesia and Malaysia.   

We have been struggling as to how to respond to this review as it is factually incorrect with many contradictions and we are not even sure if you mixed up Santani with another resort you stayed at. We are very dissapointed when our guests have negative experiences at Santani, which is not the case as you can see from all the reviews. However, in this case, it seems you were either terribly mixed up or had ulterior motives.   

While you mention in your review that you were sick on the first day and that you did not like the design elements of the bungalows, you continued to stay at the resort and after enjoying everything Santani has to offer, you had asked for a refund. That does not make sense and if you did not understand the product and if it was not the luxury and healthy gastronomy you wanted, you could have checked out the next morning. 

Therefore, we are led to believe that you were trying to get a refund of your stay during the peak season.   It also baffles us as you were asking for very unhealthy street food from Indonesia and Malaysia that typically costs about $2 at a fine dining restaurant and thinking it’s the national food of Sri Lanka.   

As for some of the factually incorrect statements you have made, we want to clarify these details so that potential visitors are not deceived by your wrong statements.   

• The temperature at Santani, which is located in the Kandy region at an elevation of ~900M elevation never goes below 15 degrees and all beds are draped in thick duvets and extra blankets are provided in the wardrobe. We had full occupancy during the Christmas season and none of our guests had any issues related to this. Hot water bottles are also placed in the room on request.   

•	We have a full wardrobe with two closets for hanging garments and multiple drawers for folded garments. Below them are two compartments with rolling slides to keep 40KG bags. The wardrobe is also equiped with a mini fridge, a safe, laundry baskets, hangers, umbrellas etc that were all shown to any guests when checking in.   

• The open door toilet is a design concept that is part of our concept and anyone genuinely coming to Santani already knows about it. Its mentioned in all our external communications. However, no one can see the inside of the toilet from anywhere in the room and privacy is assured.   

•	In terms of the ‘lack of comfort’, we are not sure what you are referring to. We do not have items associated with traditional luxury such as TV’s and sound systems, but this is part of our concept, which is intelligent luxury and is appreciated much more by the discerning travellers.   

•	We assume that the lack of coverage you mentioned was in relation to wi-fi. We do not have wi-fi in public areas and that is communicated clearly prior to your visit. Limited wifi is one of Santani’s attractions and what our guests visit us for. We do however have wifi in the rooms, and have had no issues in relation to the speed of this.  

•	We serve a three course meal for lunch, that starts with bread and a dip, a salad or soup, a main course (fish or meat) and a desert. The dinner is four courses with an added appetizer. However, during the Christmas period, we had a five course dinner. All meals are personalised and adapted to our guests needs but within fine dining realm. We certainly do not serve unhealthy carb filled meals such as Nasi Gorang, and we do provide the option of authentic Sri Lankan meals as well as western cuisine.   

Unfortunately it seems you were trying to get three free nights at a property for luxury discerning travelers and you have clearly not been able to appreciate the same things that all our other guests travel across the world for. We certainly do not condone scams, and this clearly was an attempt to scam the property which did not work in your favour, so we believe that the title of the review is quite apt in the context of your intentions. 

We thank you for the great feedback about the massages, and it is one of the reasons that Santani is considered one of the best spas in the world.   

Warm regards, 
Chamindra Goonewardene
placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
A scam !
Stayed 3 nights and had a nightmare and a big disappointment.
We wanted to spend the Christmas holidays in love while enjoying a quiet and relaxing. Unfortunately it was the opposite.
From the first night I got sick because the bungalows billed at 800 euros per night was all open even though the outside temperature was around 5 ° C.
The bungalows are of no comfort:
• No storage space
• The toilet without doors open on the room (it's very romantic especially when the room is very small)
• Lack of comfort
• Lack of coverage
From your room could admire a beautiful landscape, but nothing exceptional either. But it was especially the occasion to listen to the noises of the nature like the discussions, the flushing and the farts of the other customers ......
The meal was very disappointing.
There was no menu or card, which can be interesting. The hotel communicates a lot about their heathy gastronomy and their ability to adapt to our tastes. IT'S WRONG.
At lunchtime we were treated to a small salad and a tiny dessert, while in the evening they served us a 4-course menu! They refused to prepare the most popular dish in the country, Nasi Goreng, because they did not have the right spices. We had made this request in the morning for the evening ....
Orders are taken in the morning for noon, noon for the evening and the evening for the morning, nothing is ready at the last minute everything is warmed and it feels.

The spa is not very beautiful but the massages are exceptional.
We expressed our disappointment to the person who made our reservation the next morning. She told us the night before we left saying she could not pay us back and gave us totally ridiculous explanations!
Thanks to this experience I no longer accept to pay the entire stay in advance.
title: A SCAM

ownerResponse/text:
Jannik, 

Firstly, we are very sorry to hear that you had a disappointing stay, as it is certainly not in line with the standards that we have been keeping from the very inception. This is the first time we have had such feedback as you can see from the other reviews on TripAdvisor and we have over 96% great rating after over 2 years of operations. We are really surprised by your review specially as you never mentioned any of these apart from the lunch on the day of departure while you were staying with us. Therefore, we have initiated a thorough review of your stay and all possible corrective action are taken so these will not be repeated and we maintain our excellent service record as we have done in the past.  While we appreciate the constructive feedback provided, we feel further clarification is needed with some of these points. 

We are glad that you enjoyed the food and the view which are two of our key selling points. In general it seems you have visited us without understanding the product and what is offered. We understand and accept that Santani is not for all. We are not catering to the segment that is looking for standard indulgent luxury. We cater to the segment who has already experienced indulgences at the highest level and now seeking a higher form of luxury which we have delivered successfully and being recognised for it globally. 

Pricing : 

Our pricing is certainly in line or more expensive than some properties across Europe and that shouldn’t be a point of surprise. We have been consistently rated as one of the best spas / wellness retreats in the world, and therefore to be ‘even more expensive than one in Europe’ is a point that we are certainly willing to take and accept. Our reviews on all platforms are over 95% reflecting the quality of the product and service delivery. Also, please note that our prices includes the following for 2 people. 3 fine dining meals of Michelin quality, two 90 minute sessions of yoga and meditation, guided walks, use of steam, sauna, and thermal baths. Three meals itself for 2 people of Santani standard would cost close to $700 in any major city. 

Spa Inclusions : 

Since you were only staying for 4 nights, you were not on a wellness package, and therefore were not entitled to a full Ayurvedic consultation. Once again, although you may have expected it, our consultations are not included unless you are on a wellness package. Your reservation clearly indicated what was included and not and we do not even see a communication gap in this regard and we are at a loss why you were expecting some of these you have mentioned. Again note that the Ayurvedic Consultation is with a qualified doctor and lasts for 90 minutes. What we are charging is a fraction of what an hour and a half with a Doctor would cost in any Western Country. 

Sound from the temple

On some days, the local temple, which is located on the other side of the valley does engage in prayer activities in the morning. Almost  all of our guests find this very soothing and have specifically mentioned about the chanting in other reviews in such a positive way. While you may have considered disturbance in some way, this is part of being in a Sri Lankan village and in the wilderness, where the noise travels across the mountain. There is a cultural element involved here. There is a certain energy and emotion in the region, and the chanting from the local temple on occasion certainly adds to this level of authenticity. As you also know, we are a wellness focused resort that focuses on an Intelligent luxury that goes beyond the mundane amenities and standards. Waking up with the sun and aligning ourselves in to the primal rhythms of nature is one key elements of intelligent luxury as well as wellbeing. Its unfortunate, we were not able to provide you the peace that all our guests experience through the environment they are in.

Extra Lunch
If you had read through the booking confirmation, you would have noted that the you are on full board basis, which means that you are entitled to 3 meals per day. Given that you had lunch on day 1, you are entitled to all meals until breakfast on your day of checkout. We do accept the fact that this should have been informed to you earlier, so you would have time to adjust accordingly. All lunches at Santani are 3 course meals and include a soup, a main meal and a dessert. That was what was offered to on that day, and something that you had agreed to. However, that is something you had the ability to speak to our chef and change if you wanted something else. Regardless, you should have been informed earlier, and we do apologize for this miscommunication on our part.

Overall, while you have spent this amount of money at the resort and you have enjoyed the food, the views and the kind and friendly staff as per all the other positive reviews we have received, it is clear that your expectations were different to what we are and further reading on the inclusions would have cleared up any issues earlier. We have tried to contact you multiple times in order to speak to you directly, but have not been able to get through to you. 

If we are not mistaken, you were referred here by one of our past guests who stayed at the resort for 21 nights and is set to return in a few months again, and she truly enjoyed the resort and considered the entire staff as part of her family. 

It is unfortunate that you were not able to experience Santani positively and that you had opened a TripAdvisor account purely to write about this experience. We apologize for some of the shortcomings mentioned above, but we do hope that you will return to experience it in a different light than you did on this occasion.

Warm regards,
Chamindra
placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
Where do I start?!.. These past four days have been very interesting to us, unfortunately not in a good way. We are a couple who is used to traveling and which likes to explore different places. From high end to average places we enjoy exploring other cultures and accommodations. To come straight to the point: the price we invested into Santani-Resort is not acceptable!

For over 700 USD a night you at least expect some benefits like an ayurveda introduction or a well equipped spa. In fact one massage with a “discount” of 25% is even more expensive than getting one in Europe with the same Ayurveda-treatment. The staff is kind and friendly, unfortunately though not used to fulfill the needs of western expectations in in this price category. We haven’t been served our dinner at the same time once for the past four days due to the service. In addition to that the staff seemed to have a hard time to understand to bring us some plain tomatoes or avocado for our breakfast. Things we thought were basic seemed to be groundbreaking requests here. 

Besides that the food and the view from the resort were lovely. Western standards which meet the local cuisine.

The spa unfortunately was like the rooms: Disappointing! The spa-staff seemed mostly confused and not really knowing how to consult us when it comes to Ayurveda or basic massages. Also every guest is “welcome” to spend another 150$ per person to be consulted which treatment and which diet is appropriate for them. By spending over 700 USD a night you would at least expect these kind of “consultancies” being included in the price. 

The beds in the rooms are ok. The open toilet, the dark bathroom lighting and no air conditioning takes time getting used to though. Friends of us and ourselves haven’t been able to sleep through the night due to a temple which is close by and where loud noises and prayers come from every morning around 6. 

All in all we are leaving this place disappointed. The reason for us writing this review is due to our final experience at Santani where we have been told by the guest manager to receive a lunch before our departure which will be covered by the hotel. When we came to the restaurant to receive the lunch - one hour before leaving - exactly the same manager informed us that he will charge now 32$ for a meal (the meal would have included a soup and a quinoa salad). That is unacceptable! 

This place feels like a total rip off and by having spent more than 4000 USD for four nights, we definitely wont recommend it to anyone nor come here again.
title: Very disappointing service, pictures are misleading!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Vailima30

We are truly sorry that Santani was not what you expected and the inconveniences caused. We are also baffled by your review, as all the items you have mentioned are in fact what all our guests like and what made us one of the most unique hotels of the world as selected by Forbes Magazine and one of the best spas/new hotels of the world as per numerous industry experts.  It is a clear mismatch of what you were looking for and the Santani concept rather than a substandard product or service. . We wish you had spent some time to understand the product and concept of Santani. Meaning reading some of the five and four star reviews that we have received which describes what Santani is all about. As you can see, these reviews comprise around 98% of our total ratings.

The distance to Kandy, not having air conditioning, open rooms, natural surroundings or being part of nature etc are all part of Santani’s attraction and are well discussed in all our external communications including our website as well as on our guest reviews on TripAdvisor and other online platforms. As you know, we have excellent ratings on all these platforms as well. 

I take this opportunity to further discuss Santani philosophy and uniqueness so anyone reading this will get a better understanding and we wont have mismatches such as this. Santani focuses on intelligent luxury as opposed to indulgent luxury that is generally the case in standard hotels. We cater to discerning guests who have already experienced material indulgences and are now seeking higher level of luxury that is also high in social, environmental, and community impact. The architectural design, wellness philosophy and service philosophy are all designed to first provide mental and physical relaxation of the highest level while also providing the best food, spa treatments, and service in Sri Lanka. We focus on minimizing stimulations to the mind that in turn slows down the mind and allow it to truly relax. A truly relaxed mind is the ultimate luxury in todays stressed world and is the most unaffordable luxury.  In addition to the clear lines and minimal design, this is achieved through the integration of nature (allowing you to harmonize with the natural rhythms), personalized fine dining cuisine that again harmonizes with your body types and needs, and spa treatments that are specially designed to alleviate mental and physical fatigue. 

Whilst noting our thoughts above, we extend our apologies for any inconvenience caused by this mismatch.
placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text: We booked for three nights and only stayed one night. Could not get out of there fast enough and gave up our other nights and massages. Set a very long way from Kandy which means you are stuck there at the end of a very bad road. Visiting Kandy from there is out of the question. One and only plus was the restaurant meals. Very good. Otherwise everything else is poor. Rooms are unbearably hot during the day and freezing at night. No air conditioning. Rooms are small and basic and I mean basic. Concrete walls and blinds that do not block out heat or light - awakened very early in the morning. Two poor quality chairs inside and two chairs on balcony which were also cheap and uncomfortable. Toilet has no door, no privacy and full length window. Pool is uninviting and the spa area too is not welcoming. Staff at spa very stuffy. Grounds of resort consist of grass - weed and paths are only dirt. No idea where this concept has come from. But from a tourist perspective this resort has really missed the mark by a long way. There a many other negatives and I think management needs to revisit what is being presented to the tourist public. Not good.
title: Not a good experience

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Giulia,

We are so sorry that you could not experience the same excellence that Santani is known for. As you mentioned, we have had many reviews and we have not had a single bad review. We have done a full review of your stay and have already taken some corrective action on certain areas. It seems you have missed most of our offerings such as free morning and evening yoga, excursions and use of the spa facilities given the less than 24 hour stay you had at Santani. 

I want to further explain some of our processes and offerings for the benefit of anyone reading and to make sure the expectations are set right.

As for the signage, we have over 15 sign boards in a 12 KM stretch since the turn off from the main road. Also, the road is paved and in excellent condition till the last turn off, which is only about a 1 KM estate road. (this part is also being paved currently) We communicate with the drivers throughout the arrival process and if any vehicle is finding it difficult to make the last 1 KM, we send a resort vehicle to the last turn off to pick them up. We ask for the contact number of the driver to facilitate this with every guest as part of our pre-arrival process.For some unfortunate reason, we did not receive a response from you after multiple requests to provide the number of the driver. 

The toilet is designed with the overall concept of openness and being one with nature.  Also, one of the key ethos of Santani is about being comfortable with ourselves and whoever we are with. However, no one in the room can see anyone sitting inside the toilet unless one purposely look in. We understand this may be an  unusualfeeling at the beginning of a stay but guests appreciate the conceptual significance as they settle in. 

You may have missed all the toiletries during your short stay but we have everything any hotel has from Shampoo, Conditioner, Bath Gel, Soap, Body Lotion, cotton pads, ear buds, etc. We also note that all of them are organic and natural locally sourced products of the highest quality and some of our guests buy these toiletries to take home. 

The fruit basket is designed to consume with your hands. However, we understand some guests may prefer to use cutlery and we will address it. Thank you for pointing that. 

In regard to the spa, we certainly try to be responsive to each guest’s request with the highest emphasis. However, by the time you had contacted the spa, it was really late. The team tried to rearrange some of the already scheduled appointments just to accommodate your request as we knew you had less than 24hrs with us. That’s why it took 20 minutes to get back to you. Unfortunately, we could not rearrange any of the scheduled appointments and we offered the first appointment the next day but we understand you did not take it as you were leaving early morning. 

We have taken note of the drinks and like to advise that we are already in the process of offering a wider variety of beverages. 

Again, we would like to kindly remind that throughout our external communications (as well as in most of TripAdvisor comments), we say that Santani is best experienced over a minimum of 3 nights. Relaxation and experiencing is a process and it is difficult to experience much and relax when a person  is in a rush. I sincerely hope you would come again and stay for about 3 days. We will certainly ensure your return will be worth it.This would also allow you to better experience Santani and its uniqueness. 

Again, we are really sorry about your experience and we have taken note of things to improve.
placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotels design is interesting and the view is beautiful and quite. We also had a good dinner and the breakfast was really good! 

The rest of the experience was far away from good. Most roads in Sri Lanka aren’t the best, but the road to come to this place was the road to hell. There are no signs to the lobby so our poor driver took the wrong turn and we almost crashed our car. How can the hotel management not put any signage and/or staff to show people where to go! This is a disaster! 

Be aware that there is no door to the toilet in the room, so you won’t get any privacy whatsoever. 

This place I really minimalistic, with no toiletries besides soap, shampoo and some cotton pads. We got a really nice basket of fruit when we arrived but there was no cutlery to cut it.........

It’s also very quite, so if you are unlucky and get a loud neighbor it could disturb your relaxation time. 

We were told that we could access the spa, but in our attempt to book a massage, we had to call 3 times and wait 20 minutes for someone to get back to us. Just to say that  there were no available spots. 

The food that is served at the restaurant is great! The problem is that the range of drinks is very poor, they couldn’t even do basic drinks and when we asked for a second glass of sparkling wine they said that they had run out of it....

My final words would be that this place has a lot of potential, but is definitely over priced for what is offered to its clients. It has been running for over 1 year now but it seems like they opened just the other day. Can’t believe that they got so many good reviews from other past guests.
title: Not much good to say about this place

text:
La photo de ce duplex ne montre pas qu'il n'y a pas de fenêtre et que la porte donne sur le restaurant et la terrasse ! Bruyant.
Sinon, bien placé, personnel souriant sauf le couple de managers.
Problème au moment du paiement, nos 2 CB VISA furent refusées (le patron n'avait pas le bon terminal...) et sous entendaient que nous ne pouvions le payer, sympa ! Nos visa passaient partout ailleurs. Nous avons du donner toutes nos espèces, ce qui complique la vie pour la suite du voyage !
En vérité, il préférait un paiement en espèce !! Départ à 6 h du matin, pas de box brekfast préparées et personne pour porter nos bagages. L'hôtel était fermé...Inacceptable !
Je ne recommande pas, il y a plein d'autres hôtels.

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Not quite sure how this hotel manages to get a five star rating. This was the last hotel of five in an eight night stay in Sri Lanka and we were extremely disappointed. We were doing a package trip and were not informed that they had no alcohol licence but they were happy to let us bring our own wine. For dinner we had to select in advance our dinner choices from 2 options for each course. At dinner we realised it was because we were the only guests. My chicken main course was extremely over salted and the vegetables were cold. On the positive side the staff were extremely helpful once you found them. I’m sorry but our worst experience in Sri Lanka.
title: Worst experience in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Informed in advance that the hotel reservation would be refunded, saying that the policy does not allow refunds, and I was very angry with such overlord clauses. For a hotel that is not customer-oriented, the service must not be much better. I do not recommend this hotel.
title: Unscrupulous hotels unwilling to refund booking fees

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ranura,
Greetings from Yara Galle Fort and thank you for your review. We believe what motivates you for this review could be that you may not be convinced that we agreed to refund you one night charge of the additional booking, even though we are not at fault. Refunding money won't take place overnight especially on an occasion like this and it is not easy to send money from Sri Lanka to another country especially during a crisis situation like we are suffering at present. If we have charged your credit card then it is just a matter of informing our banking partner to refund. Please accept our apology for any inconvenience caused to you.
However, with regard to your review we wish to state following;
1). You had reserved your room with a different online travel agent which we are not registered with or do business with. However, your booking came to us via another OTA which we do work with. There was a reservation for 2 Rooms under the same name and that was the very reason why I myself inquired from you whether there was anyone else joining you. Since you said no, we were under the impression that booking was for another guest as 2 reservations was made not on same date but on 2 different dates and both reservations were pre-paid.
2). I recall we clearly explained to you during our email conversations, both of these bookings were prepaid by the online agent which we got the booking from and since the hotel was full on 5th November we had to charge for the 2nd booking though there was no one who checked in.
3). As you requested, we were not in a position to refund you as we have not charged your card. We have collected the payment from the online travel agent’s Virtual card. Even if we refunded as you may know we have to pay the commission to the agent for the 2nd booking also as there was a valid booking. That was the reason why I wrote to you to inform you to contact your travel agent and request the refund. The agent could then request a refund from us. However there was no request to date either from your Online Travel Agent or  ours.
4). We believe if you would have informed your agent of this issue then and there right after you receive SMS from your bank indicating the charge on your credit card, this would have been easily avoided.
5). As you are well aware, if we were thieves and desperate for money as you claimed, we wouldn't be able to maintain good reviews on many online platforms and agree to refund you one night charge even though we lost our potential revenue.
We hope you will give us another opportunity to serve you at Yara Galle Fort.

Thank You
placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: I was charged twice for a room, turned out there was 2 room under my name but the hotel didn't even tell me when i checked in - i found after my holiday when i saw my bank statement with two room charges. Still no refund after multiple emails. I came to Sri lanka to do unpaid volunteering service in the countries biggest economic crisis and I was charged double for a stay I guess they are desperate  for the money - avoid this hotel.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear foodfightbbq,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We are sincerely sorry to hear that your experience fell short of expectations, and we appreciate the opportunity to address your concerns.

Firstly, we deeply regret any discomfort you experienced during your stay, particularly in relation to your room allocation and interactions with other guests. We understand how important a honeymoon trip is, and we sincerely apologise for the misunderstanding regarding the room type. Our records indicate that your reservation was part of a group booking consisting of two double and two twin rooms, as per the travel agent’s voucher. We were not informed that this was a honeymoon booking until your final day, at which point our Front Office Manager, Thushara, personally discussed the matter with you and shared the original booking details. We appreciate your understanding at that time and your acknowledgment that the room type was not a major concern compared to other matters.

With regard to the unfortunate incident involving a child near your balcony, we investigated the matter thoroughly. CCTV footage confirmed that a young child, part of a neighbouring family, briefly entered the garden area outside your room and tapped on your window around 8 a.m. Our team acted promptly upon receiving your complaint; the child's parents were immediately approached and expressed their sincere apologies. The family checked out the same day, and the father wished to personally apologise to you in the lobby, though we understand and respect your decision to decline the meeting.

We are truly sorry for any unease or distress this situation caused you and your wife. Please rest assured that guest safety and privacy remain a top priority for us, and we are reinforcing supervision in public areas to avoid such incidents in the future.

Regarding your dining experience, we acknowledge the concern about queue management and guest etiquette. While we cannot control individual behaviour, we fully agree that our restaurant team should be more proactive in such situations. We have already begun implementing enhanced training for our staff to better manage and support orderly service during peak meal times.

We are disappointed that your overall experience did not reflect the warmth and hospitality we aim to offer every guest. Your feedback has been shared across departments to ensure lessons are learned and improvements made.

We genuinely hope you will consider giving us another opportunity in the future to deliver the stay you rightfully expected and deserve.

Warm regards,
Team Amaya Hills
placeInfo/address: Heerassagala, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Heerassagala, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
Please avoid this hotel, there are much better ones in the area.

The third stop during our tour through Sri Lanka (7 in total). The property is pretty, the view of Kandy is wonderful. That’s about it.

In my opinion,  I would avoid this place at all costs. Certain guests here have a reputation for being intolerant of foreigners, and we felt it first hand here. A mother asking to cut in line to get her child’s omelette was just a guise to order for her whole table, which she was unhappy about (I didn’t get eggs that day). Lots of cutting lines during dinner, stealing of chairs and tables, etc. We were in constant anxiety during this stay.

Our final straw was our second morning, around 7am, we woke up to a 12 year old kid peering through our balcony door trying to get access to my room (room 56, garden view). My wife is beautiful and was clearly noticed the day before - was he trying to peep on her? Was he trying to break in and rob us? What if he gained access and I injured him defending ourselves? The hotel assured that there were not children in our vicinity, so how did that happen?

Hotel management complained about being unable to manage certain guests, and implied that these issues arise often. They apologized but said they couldn’t do anything about it. Where I’m from, peeping on someone is a crime. I am aware our tour company is looking into the matter and we have advised to pull this hotel from all future tours.

Oh and lastly, they gave us a room with two single beds for our honeymoon lol do better.

UPDATE: The hotel has been flagging this review to get it removed, but I'll just keep editing it so it remains.
title: There are many better options in the area

I had the worst experience staying at Amaya Hills, Kandy. The bathroom was incredibly small, with no proper shower area. You’re forced to stand inside a bathtub to bathe—completely inconvenient and uncomfortable. For the amount they charged, this was absolutely not worth it.

The photos on Agoda were misleading. We booked a Premium Deluxe Room based on the advertised images showing a spacious room with a living area and sofas. However, the reality was far different—a tiny room with smelly beds and an old, worn-out feel. It was frustrating to pay $290 USD for something that wasn’t even worth $100 USD.

The service in the restaurant was just as disappointing. The staff seemed more interested in clearing tables than attending to guests. Even for water, we had to repeatedly call the servers. No one approached us to ask if we needed assistance or anything else.

Overall, this is an old hotel with poor amenities and terrible service. I would not recommend staying here to anyone. It’s a total waste of money. Avoid at all costs!
title: worst hotel in kandy..not even worth for 3*
