Dear Valued guests, 
 
We sincerely apologize for any discomfort you experienced during your stay at our hotel in Kandy. We take all guest feedback seriously, and we'd like to address your concerns.
 
Firstly, we understand that there may have been some confusion regarding the hotel's accommodation policies. Your reservation was made for two people on a Half Board (HB) basis, but it seems that five people, including children aged 16, 12, and 8, were part of your group. As per our hotel policies, children above the age of 12 are considered adults, and if children below 12 years share a room with their parents, a meal supplement is mandatory. Our team tried their best to accommodate your needs and requirements within the framework of these policies.
 
Regarding the delay in providing your room, we regret any inconvenience caused. We understand that waiting for 45 minutes after the check-in time is not an ideal start to your stay, and we will certainly review our check-in procedures to improve guest experiences in the future but due to the aforementioned confusion, an elaborate check-in process was required.
 
Concerning the cleanliness and maintenance of our property, we take these issues seriously. We will work to ensure that our rooms and common areas are well-maintained and free of any hygiene concerns. Your feedback about dead insects in the corridor is duly noted, and we will reinforce our cleaning procedures to prevent such issues in the future.
 
In terms of internet connectivity, we tried our best to provide a solution during your stay by offering in-room Wi-Fi, as the central Wi-Fi system was unable to function, owing to the multiple devices in one room. 
 
As for your request for four beds in a triple room, please understand that our hotel policies do not allow for more than three beds in a triple room. 
We regret any inconvenience this may have caused and appreciate your understanding of these limitations.
 
We genuinely value your stay with us and always strive to prioritize our customers' comfort and satisfaction. While we understand that your experience may not have met your expectations, we hope this response clarifies our efforts to accommodate your group within our policies. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you encountered and look forward to serving you better in the future.
 
Thank you for your feedback, and we appreciate your understanding.

Warm regards, 
Management - Amaya Resorts & Spas

placeInfo/address: Heerassagala, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Heerassagala, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
Disappointed with this property, really dated interiors and fittings, needs an overhaul not a refurbishment. Things started badly with a very delayed and incomplete room service order, even though I made sure to clarify the order on the phone twice (because I suspected the room service staffer was not operating on all cylinders judging from the conversation). Although the kitchen and staff ultimately made good on this mishap by expediting the remaining order and offering complimentary beverages, it did spoil the arrival. Dinner later which was a buffet was also disappointing and whilst it was broad and there was a lot of it, there were also a lot of people clamouring around it. This property seems to be very popular with large groups and therefore be ready for a bit of an elbow fight around the meat section. Regrettably I lacked the Mandarin  politely to say, “excuse me kind madam, but there is a queue - we must all wait our turn for the lamb chops”. Tragically I suspect it may not have mattered in the slightest.  Final note on the catering: desserts at dinner were pretty bad, even the ones I was able to identify. Breakfast is very missable, though it’s an opportunity for a cup of tea viewing the hills.

Our room was palatial and had a great view from the balcony. But the fittings and furniture were as old as the hills that the property overlooks and the bathroom was the ultimate expression of this. Water was very hot though.

The best parts are: 1) the view which is pretty stunning, 2) the pool which looks over the landscape which is great not just because of the view but also because it’s really deep - 8ft at its deepest - which is not the case for many hotel pools and there’s a big shallow bit as well, and 3) the staff are generally very polite - if less capable in English than some of the staff we have encountered in other parts of Sri Lanka.

For a night, on the way to somewhere like Nuwara Eliya, it’s tolerable. But I suspect there are far better properties even for this purpose. Sadly, I’d have to say: avoid.

(Actually visited December 2019)
title: Only strong point is the view

text:
The hotel is on a hill with beautiful views over Kandy and the surrounding hills and boasts a large and nice swimming pool. 
But it is nor worth the extra trip from downtown on a winding and narrow road, not easy at night. 
Our room was a little dull and tired and bathroom small and really in need of total renovation with damp spots and damage everywhere. 
Food not special apart from desserts.
We were very kindly treated with an anniversary cake in our bedroom. 
Helpful staff, apart from a couple of people not particular nice. A special thank to Rukmal who went beyond himself to help us and make us feel welcomed. The low rating is due to the very tired bathroom and the room.
title: In need of love and care

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Bilal,
Thank you for sharing your feedback. We genuinely appreciate your input and are sorry to hear that your experience did not fully meet expectations. We strive to provide excellent service and offer a variety of options to suit our guests, and we will certainly take your comments into consideration as we continually work on improving our communication regarding the different dining choices and associated charges.

As per the government regulations, the 18% VAT and 10% service charge are mandatory, and unfortunately, we are unable to waive these fees. We understand this can sometimes be frustrating, and we appreciate your understanding in this regard.

We are glad that you enjoyed the offerings and found our lifeguard and staff helpful. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future for a more positive experience. Thank you again for your feedback, and we wish you all the best!
Warm Regards,
Management Team,
Heritance Ahungalla.
placeInfo/address: Galle Road, Ahungalla 80562 Sri Lanka
roomTip: There is better options out there
text: I really don’t think this hotel represents the kind and lovely people of Sri Lanka. From the time we came, it just seemed like things were complicated.   We were initially told by reception that the only option we could really explore was paying $28  per day to go half board. We were not even told about the à la carte option.  The a la cart option also had additional fees. They don’t tell you that you have to pay an additional 18% on VAT, and then 10% on service charge.   Food took a long time to be prepared, and sometimes we were sat there for over 45 minutes waiting for food.   On the first day we were told that we could not have separate bills because it had already been through on the system  however when we address this with management, this was sorted in a professional way and they did offer for us to have 10% off the bill the next time we went  However, I thought that the damage had already been done. The lifeguard is very nice and helpful. In general, the staff are nice, but I feel like some staff  are not open and honest with you about the different options available.  I think this is the thing about bigger hotels, you don’t get the personal touch and a warmth and empathy that we experience in the rest of Sri Lanka.    I stayed for three days, and to be honest I don’t think I would’ve wanted to stay longer.
title: Not worth the money

placeInfo/address: Galle Road, Ahungalla 80562 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Galle Road, Ahungalla 80562 Sri Lanka
text:
Disappointing Dining Experience at Ahungalla Heritance

I had high expectations when visiting Ahungalla Heritance (part of the Aitken Spence chain), but the food quality was a major disappointment. The lunch buffet was underwhelming, with most dishes lacking salt and flavor. The fried rice, made with samba rice, was a poor choice and didn’t complement the rest of the dishes at all.

Tea-time snacks were no better—minimal variety and nothing appetizing or memorable. We even raised our concerns with the chefs, but unfortunately, there was no noticeable improvement.

For a reputed hotel chain, the dining experience was far below standard. I hope the management takes this feedback seriously and works on upgrading their food quality and variety.
title: Annual Day outing of YSIS..

placeInfo/address: Galle Road, Ahungalla 80562 Sri Lanka
text:
This is meant to be a 5 star hotel, but is lacking in so many areas.

The positives first. The restaurant staff and room cleaning staff were excellent.  The rooms are very nice, spacious and beds are extremely comfortable.

Unfortunately the reception staff and management were extremely unhelpful and didn’t address issues when highlighted.

We visited during Sri Lankan new year and we knew shops and restaurants would be closed, we asked the reception staff and were advised Fri and sat (which is what we expected) I also asked if they knew if restaurants in Galle would be open on the Sunday and was advised they would all be closed as still new year so better to stay at the hotel. This was incorrect as a discovered through a Facebook forum and visited Galle on the Sunday were all restaurants were open. This felt like an attempt to keep you in the hotel spending money.

The prices at the hotel were also questionable. The hotel we stayed in the week before had clear pricing on there menu  eg Nani goreng 1800 Sri Lankan rupees.  The heritance menu do 10% state service charge to be added, but also to be added is 18% vat meaning the prices stated which were already at least 20% higher than the previous 5star rated hotel we had stayed in were much more costly than other similarly rated hotels and more concerningly this isn’t clear.

The pools open at 8am which is fine as they need to clean them, but the bed cover and towels aren’t available until 8am and as I am an early riser and like to get up and spend some time in the sun before breakfast and the sun gets too hot this was disappointing. Also out of the 5 nights we stayed here I had to trek around the resort on 3 separate days to find a pool attendant as you can’t get the mattress and towels yourself, having gone to reception on 2 occasions it took until 9 am on 2 of the days to get the towels and mattresses, and all the manager Clive could do was apologise, which given it happened again the following morning was very poor. The issue clearly hadn’t been addressed. Also around the pool, wasn’t cleaned with cigarette ends (dissapointing that’s scruffy guests leave this is the first place) plastic bottles and beer caps left on the grass for the last 4 days we were there. 

I would not recommend this hotel to stay at and instead would highly recommend the 5 star Taj Bentota which is only 20 minutes away and is excellent with much more around the hotel as well which if you want to explore is great.
title: Very dissapointing stay here, wouldn’t stay here again.

placeInfo/address: Galle Road, Ahungalla 80562 Sri Lanka
text:
Добрый день. Не любитель оставлять отзывы и в принципе лень этим заниматься , однако, после определенных нюансов , все же решил написать. Отдыхал с супругой с начала августа в этом отеле через туроператора "Анекс Тур". Начитавшись положительных отзывов и посмотрев красивые фото на букинге, приняли решение ехать в этот отель, без раздумий , даже не смущало , что не сезон и то, что со стороны где расположен отель, в это время большие волны.
В общем, начну с плюсов. 
А именно: отель находится среди пальм и множества деревьев по которым прыгают маленькие бурундучки и летают красивые птички , пляж очень большой и широкий , длина составляет около 3,5 км.,но убирается она только непосредственно перед самим отелем с утра из числа местных дружинников , которых по окончании работ фотографирует сотрудник местной полиции. Отель Хеританс 5 звёзд имеет: 2 бассейна , один маленький спорт зал, ресторан , один бар. Вот в принципе и всё из плюсов.) 
Не хочу в ваших глазах быть человеком-занудой, чтоб не думали :" ну есть такие люди, которым вечно что-то не нравится.",так как сам так думал когда перед покупкой тура читал несколько подобных отзывов.  Приехав в отель, нас встретили девушки с белыми улыбками. Очень порадовало позитивное настроение персонала, всегда улыбается. Всегда. Но, как оказалось , что из выполнения своих профессиональных задач по поддержанию комфортного размещения клиента , это был единственный хорошо отработанный навык. 
Проще говоря , помимо того, что отелю больше 60-ти лет, его техническое состояние оставляет желать лучшего. Помимо запаха "бабушкиного дивана на даче" , никто не планирует освежать отель и следить за его чистотой, порядком в помещениях, номерах, мойке стекол и санитарной дезинфекции! 
В первый день как приехали , и зашли в номер , я обратил внимание, на то что слив в душевой забит и слив в туалете не работает достаточно хорошо, чтоб выполнить свою функцию. Спустившись в ресторан , я не являюсь человеком брезгливым и дотошным, я был не приятно удивлен что столы просто напросто липкие как в пельменной! Оконные стекла безууумно грязные и в зале летают мухи, которые садятся вам в тарелку. Супруга плакала, увидев это всё..настроение было ужасное. Ни разу, ни разу за все время не было на столе бумажных салфеток. перечница и солонка очень редко встречалась на столах. Но больше всего меня и других посетителей из Европы поразило то, что 95% блюд безумно острые! За пару дней до отъезда я не выдержал и попросил показать салаты и горячие блюда без "карри" и "черного перца". Ресторан я бы НИКОГДА не назвал рестораном. Встречают красиво, открывают двери , улыбаются, НО еда и обслуживание ниже плинтуса! После приема пищи нужно дожидаться , когда закроют чек, и расписываться в нулевом чеке , о том что ты не остался должен за напитки. Да да, даже если у вас "всё включено", даже если вы выпили колу или местный арак бесплатный. Чек несут очень долго. Много оставлял на чай, но все равно работать не хотят.
 С противоположной стороны , так называемого " ресторана" с мухами, липкими столами, грязными стеклами  находится бар. Где можно купить алкоголь , картошку фри и бургер. Большую часть времени питались там , там нет острой пищи совсем! В опцию " всё включено" входит вышеперечисленные позиции и алкогольные напитки местного разлива. Все что другое- платно. Работает пару часов до обеда и час после-на приготовление пищи.
Кстати, после 24.00  выпить колы , виски или курить пачку сигарет невозможно. Всё �� отеле закрыто. За пределами отеля магазины не работают после нуля часов. Из досуга возле бара с платными напитками есть зона где играет местный музыкант до 23.00. Возле выхода к океану постоянно дежурят местные торгаши и попрошайки . Их на территорию не пускают охранники , но они через сетчатый забор наблюдают за вами,когда пойдете купаться на пляж. Выглядит забавно, поскольку вы находитесь в 7-10 метрах на лежаках у бассейна в сторону океана , видите их, а они вас) они смотрят на вас, а вы на них) как в зоопарке , не ясно только кто зверёк. 
Персонал очень очень ленивый, кто бы что не писал , что они стараются. Это не правда. Пока на чай даёшь они делают вид. Ооочень медленные , ну очень. Ну и , конечно, не смог не обратить внимание на маникюр и педикюр персонала, это отдельная тема. Огромное желание было подарить маникюрные ножницы. 
Моё обращение и отзыв направлен , не для того , чтоб обхаять, а чтобы начальство приняло к сведению и сделало работу над ошибками. Потому что если вы себя оппозиционеруете как 5 звезд, то соответстуйте, будьте так любезны! А начальство научило только улыбаться и кланяться.

P.S.
В день отъезда, наш рейс переносили несколько раз. С раннего утра персонал отеля видел как мы сидели и ждали своего автобуса, но в 12.00 как сдали свои браслеты, мы стали людьми другого сорта. В 12.10 супруга попросила хостес 2 бесплатной бутылки воды с собой в аэропорт, что обычно приносят в номер, на что та ответила с улыбкой:" а теперь это платно!" Я был настолько поражён, что думал это шутка, так как на чай я только бурундучкам на чай не давал. 
В общем,  спасибо океану и прикольным бурундучкам, они нас не разочаровали.
title: Антисанитария, ужасная еда, старая постройка, пахнет бабушкиной старой мебелью

text: We were unfortunate to stay at this hotel on a day that they celebrated the Earth Day in 2023. We love, encourage, and actively participate in similar programs.  The problem was, how the hotel management went about the celebration and their lack of planning. Hotel management decided to shut all electrical lights in the downstairs lobby area, then lighted kerosene torches. There were so may kerosene torches lit all over the area (including bar, near pool etc.) and the smell was unbearable, air was unbreathable. Add 100C temperature and humidity to the situation and it was absolute hell. What was the point of this stupid show? They probably added more pollutant to the air by burning all the kerosene for few hours than the greenhouse gases emitted to generate electricity. Stupidity at its best was in display at Heritance Ahungalla on 3/23/23.
title: Celebrated Earth Day by getting choked in air full with Kerosene

ownerResponse/text:
Hi

Thank you for choosing to stay with us . As a responsible tourism establishment having successfully operated to  ensure customer service excellence and feedback for over five years , having gone through your review , it’s quite surprising to note some of the points you have mentioned which we wish to correct .

We do understand your experience and the subsequent feedback has resulted from the community event that took place on one of the days during your event.  Hence, as guest feedback and reviews are of utmost important we wish to to correct the points you have mentioned 

1. The event you have mentioned , is indeed a community event in a nearby town which was organized for the community of the Weerailwa and Tissamaharama area which may take place. once or twice a month as the most . As with many other areas in Sri Lanka , these are organized With the consent of the local council and we as a private entity need to respect the rights of the locals too to enjoy these activities. We wish to stress that this event and sound did not come from Hilton as their banquet hall is sound proof and enclosed and we have never had complains from our guests with regard to the same . Also the event ended at 11 pm not 4 am as you have mentioned 

2. The Management of the hotel are hotel professionals with over 2 decades of experience  in the hotel industry and our operations team comprise of equally experienced and professional staff who ensures to maintain the hotel with highest standards of facilities and service . We have continually operated the hotel retaining all our team even during the vivid pandemic and upgraded some of the facilities too to ensure the best service and facilities to the guests . This is very well reflected in all our other guest reviews and wish to correct your statement that the premises are neglected . 
Our tent is 470 square feet which is larger than most of the hotel rooms in Sri Lanka and all our levee have 72 x 78 inches king size beds with 12 inch mattresses for the utmost comfort of our guests and not queen beds as you have mentioned 

3. We are passionately engaged in promoting eco-tourism and conservation within our operations involving many eco - friendly practices and community collaboration in all our activities. Hence , we find it insulting that you have inappropriately mentioned that we use the term only as a marketing gimmick . If it was , given the lengthy review , you would have undoubtedly mentioned the non- Eco friendly practices of the hotel too 

Having said that , we do empathize with you for the inconvenience of the sound from the local community event on one of the days of your stay and hope we were able to make it up to you with the explanation and complimentary wine and accompaniments our Resident Manager offered  to you and family . 

Once again, we wish to state that we provide the utmost service and care to all our guests and will continue to do so in times to come 

Best Rgds
placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here 3 nights. There are positive points here, but the negative aspects probably won’t be unique to us.

The property is owned by the same owners as the Peacock Beach Hotel. The feeling is very much “set it and forget it”, using the “eco” as more gimmick than ethos to lure in tourist dollars (plenty here that is not “eco”).

The positives: set on a stunning lake, looking out across the water to the mountains in the distance, the sounds of the birds and the wind in the trees is sublime. The pool is great. The tents are nice, with some issues. People have mentioned noise from the road but we didn’t find it objectionable. Most of the staff is charming, kind and concerned about the experience. We did 2 safaris, organised with Flamingo, both excellent. The Sri Lankan curry is fantastic, but the breakfast is forgettable, many other menu options unavailable.

Overall the property feels a bit neglected. The tent is quite small (queen beds not king), cramped and over stuffed with furniture. The electrical outlets on pillars don’t function.  One design flaw is the air con box, much too big for the space, is set right next to the bed with bright operating lights, it’s nearly impossible to sleep comfortably with it on or off. The floor fan doesn’t combat the humidity. Housekeeping was uneven and incomplete. There are plumbing and other sanitary issues. An item of value disappeared from our room. The massage was inappropriate in several ways, but one is not allowed to go into detail here.

An adjacent brand name hotel creates noise long into the night. We were informed by a formal card that there would be a “community event” that would impact our sleep. The Hilton event in question was loud partying and karaoke until 4am. The permanent nature of the card indicates that this a regular occurrence. I asked how often this happened was told “once a year”, but the name on the card was that of the previous manager who left ages ago, probably after reading the writing on the wall.  Insult to injury was the work that began at 6am with staff shovelling gravel into a wheelbarrow outside the tent right at our heads.

All in all poor value for the money. Sadly, we left feeling exhausted, but we sympathize with the kind staff, as they really are making do with a problematic situation mostly beyond their control.
title: Enough said

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
Before I jump into harsh truth for the staff to note down and improve I do have to say that we enjoyed a lot the surrounding of the property, the room and we loved the pool. Now we did not enjoy the service at all here. When you charge 280 USD a night you better also keep up with your service. The staff English level was really poor. No management team on the ground. They don't have proper receptionists as they are using the "rangers" to check guests in. The whole feeling is that they want to make the most money out of each guest. We spent 3 nights 4 days here. There's nothing around the hotel so basically all the meals were in house and activities as well. We did 2 days safari arranged by the hotel, which I do not recommend anyone doing so as the "ranger" with us barely spoke 10 sentences in 6 hours. Also limited by his English level and since he's done this 70+ times I expect some professionalism. I'm talking about 65usd per person for a half day safari (basically 3hrs finding animals). We really did not enjoy yala, had to wake up at 4:30 am arriving by the park to queue as there are 200+ Jeeps waiting outside. When someone spots a leopard 200 Jeeps rush to that spot and you have a traffic there... Really bad experience. Knowing our preference on quiet safaris the staff kept pushing us to do it (solely earning that money).

Breakfast option is way too limited and basically the same every day. I've requested for a local hopper (local pancake) breakfast 1 night in advance and was refused by the chef because he doesn't have time for it...
And the most ridiculous thing is that they provide free distilled water in the room but if you ask for water by the pool they charge you for the same free bottle selling it as mineral water.... 

There's a free 15min food massage provided to the guests but we only found this out the night before checking out.

There's definitely room for improvement but the owner better hire some proper management with foreign experience. Especially if you are opening a Hilton property next door.
title: REALLY NEED SERVICE IMPROVEMENT

text: This was my third visit to Galle Face Hotel. I was shocked at the decline in the appearance of the hotel and decrease in the professionalism of the staff. Our group of 6 arrived at a quiet time, but still the reception staff struggled to check us in and allocate our rooms (1 dbl plus 2 twin). It took 45 minutes. We booked sea view rooms and were given old, tiny, shabby rooms with a sea glimpse via our next door neighbours balcony (which was outside our window). Our room had one large and one small step to the bathroom - totally unacceptable. On a positive note, we were moved to a larger room with a partial sea view. All rooms had showers over the bath. One room had a missing screen and broken hairdryer. Windows would not open and all had drafts. Aircon was freezing unless turned off. All rooms and corridors smelled musty. The foyer staff tried at every opportunity to sell us tours, taxis and jewellery shopping experiences. Apart from the lovely verandah bar area, the hotel was in a deplorable condition and I was embarrassed to take my friends there. Ten years ago, Galle Face Hotel was beautiful. So sad to see the disintegration.
title: So disappointed

text:
Chose this hotel as our final destination for our honeymoon in Sri Lanka. We spent 12 nights in Sri Lanka. 

It's sad how much this hotel has changed, this was my 3rd time at this hotel and quite frankly my last. They could provide some sort of loyalty preference option, giving better rooms for people whom have visited previously. 

A lot of people have moved or been replaced from working this hotel. I remember the old uncle with the white bowler hat whom would welcome you when you arrived at the hotel. He was a friendly and warm presence, sadly since his passing there isn't anyone that can fill his boots. The customer service has gone worse, I asked for an ocean view for our room, and got given a room overlooking the car park with the ocean. Pathetic excuse was they were fully booked, I booked my honeymoon a year ago so their excuse was nonsense. The food is still good, but nothing special now. 

Sad as a number of hotels surrounding this hotel seem better options now.
title: Hotel not the same

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotels website states 

“Sri Lanka’s iconic landmark, The Galle Face Hotel, is situated in the heart of Colombo, along the seafront and facing the famous Galle Face Green. One of the oldest hotels east of the Suez, The Galle Face Hotel embraces its rich history and legendary traditions, utilizing them to create engaging, immersive experiences that resonate with old and new generations of travellers alike”

Sadly this old world charming hotel is in need of a new world face lift!

We booked a delux room - it was far from the delux tag given, we moved rooms to a better one albeit it was dirty and needed a further clean!

We ate in the A Lo Cubano restaurant which offers great sunset views and reasonable quality food - nothing too special but perfectly fine for our stay.

Breakfast was buffet style and disappointing, floors dirty, service areas dirty and food carts displaying more than just food - a good clean and some attention to detail would not go a miss.

Overall the hotel is in need of at the very least a deep clean and a robust approach to maintaining the first impressions of public areas or perhaps it’s now time for the owners to spend some money and make this hotel great again?

The irony - the pool bar is being refurbished- great news it’s just a pity you decided to do this in the height of the busy season so my last few hours in Sri Lanka were spent by the pool with the dulcet beat of a jack hammer and demolition work 😩

It’s clear from service that some of the staff lack training and customer care skills however many are helpful and try to do their best.

Finally, and it’s just an observation, I fully appreciate everyone has a different perspective of what good looks like and this is just mine however, reading the reviews, when a negative is written I can’t help notice the same day several positives are also written to counter balance the score - or perhaps just I’m overthinking this!
title: Old world charm lost!

Noel - Galle Face Hotel
placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
Nous avons séjourné 2 semaines dans une grande chambre vue océan avec balcon pour les fêtes de fin d'année, la chambre était vieillotte avec une fenêtre non isolée, très bruyante, l'hôtel n'est pas adapté à la clientèle européenne aussi bien au niveau normes de qualité et cuisine très épicée, le buffet international non épicé est très petit. C'est un hôtel de passage où il ne faut pas séjourner plus d'une nuit 
L'hôtel privilégie sa clientèle extérieure pour l'organisation de mariage et d'événements très bruyants ,pendant notre séjour : 3/jours, sur 2 semaines le jardin n'a été accessible qu'une journée le reste du temps il y avait des chapiteaux avec montage et démontage quotidien envahissant et bruyant. Le 31/12 l'hôtel a privatisé tout ces équipements pour une clientèle extérieure au détriment des clients, nous ne pouvions accéder à rien même pas au feu d'artifice  
Durant notre séjour l'hôtel était continuellement en travaux : piscine, front de mer sans aucune compensation et cela pendant les fêtes de fin d'année.
Le service d'organisation des excursions est très cher et nous avons été mal conseillés.
Les restaurants sont bruyants,(DJ en fin de journée ) surtout celui de la piscine ou le gérant est désagréable et réserve toutes les tables pour une clientèle extérieure qui vient pour le coucher de soleil au détriment de la clientèle de l'hôtel qui est invité à rester debout au bar pour finir sa consommation.
Les repas sont souvent servis froid, une heure après la commande, service très long.
Le personnel est gentil sauf celui de la réception qui ne comprend rien à vos demandes, les tarifs sont excessifs  150$ pour avoir la chambre à 6h30 au lieu de 14h  et 200$ pour quitter la chambre à 20h au lieu de 12h. Ces prestations sont souvent offertes aux clients pour de longs séjours.
Bref hôtel a fuire pour une clientèle européenne, pas du tout dans les normes, ne pas y séjourner plus d'une nuit , nous n'y retournerons jamais
title: Horrible séjour de 2 semaines

text:
Poor check in experience and subsequently...  Our travel companions had booked the rooms and thought they had paid in full.  We arrived at 4pm and rooms were still being cleaned.  Initially we were told the rooms hadn't been paid, but when we challenged this they said 'yes, they had'.  Our credit card was taken allegedly to pre charge incidentals, but the hotel charged $1,600! We had booked ocean view double rooms, but we're taken to side view, twin rooms.  Very unhappy at this stage...
Eventually swapped rooms, but lost WiFi - they took us off the old rooms, but took some time to set up the new rooms...
Our new rooms had obscured views, were tired and smaller, but at least were double, ocean view.
Our friends agreed to pay again and sort out when they got home.
Afternoon tea was unusually self-service, with limited tea selection for Sri Lanka, but wide range of foods and good value compared to elsewhere 
Cocktails on the lawn for sunset were good, and piping the flag down interesting, but spoilt by poor service - I had to ask for bill twice, then track down the waiter who had taken my credit card.  Although he had charged the card, he didn't initially stop his chatting with other staff to return the card.
We're here for two nights, so sincerely hope tomorrow brings a better experience!

placeInfo/address: #12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
I regret to say that our stay at the Grand Serendip Hotel in Kandy was far from the relaxing experience we hoped for. Despite our initial positive impression from their rooftop bar, our stay was marred by a series of disappointments.

We booked a deluxe room with a balcony, but upon arrival, we were informed that the room didn’t have the balcony. The hotel promised us a double upgrade for the final night, but this turned out to be an empty promise. The room we were eventually given was smaller and less appealing than our original room, with a tiny balcony that hardly met our expectations.

The issues didn’t stop there. The voucher we received for the rooftop bar was misleading. We were told we would get a free drink and a 10% discount, but when we tried to use it, the staff claimed that only the 10% discount was valid and refused to honor the free drink. The food and drinks we had were subpar, with poor quality and slow service. We were also not provided an itemized receipt for our bill, which led to confusion and frustration when we were charged inconsistently with what was promised.

The staff, particularly the head concierge Nikitha, were unhelpful and condescending. We were made to feel like an inconvenience rather than valued guests. After numerous attempts to resolve the issues, including an unacceptable bill and rude service, we were eventually offered a partial discount as compensation.

In summary, our stay was plagued with poor service, unfulfilled promises, and a lack of professionalism. I would not recommend the Grand Serendip Hotel based on our experience.
title: Horrific

roomTip: Que busquen otro hotel , hay miles en Kandy con buenas piscinas y seguro que mucho mejor servicio
text:
No puedo negar que las habitaciones están francamente bien pero el servicio es PÉSIMO . En un hotel que pagas 160 euros la noche + desayuno  , en SRI Lanka , que van de 5 estrellas el servicio es nefasto . Pedimos cenar a la carta y tardaron más de 1 hora en traernos un pánini y una pechuga de pollo a la brasa . Todo el mundo cenando de buffet, los cocineros paseándose por el restaurante y empezaron ellos a cenar y nosotros sin ser servidos . 
Terminamos cenando sentados al lado de los camareros y los cocineros y ni una simple excusa 
Posteriormente subimos al roof top a tomar un cafe ( había una mesa tomando una copa con tres personas ) y tardaron 20 minutos en servirnos 
Un absoluto desastre , están a años luz de ser un 5 estrellas y relación calidad precio para un país como este es carísimo para lo que ofrece 
Una absoluta decepción 
Por cierto …. Que nadie se espera que podrá usar la piscina, es enana , cabes exactamente 6 hamacas pegada unas a las otras . No pudimos usar ese servicio porque era imposible sentarte . Había 6 personas y con eso se llenó la piscina
title: Le falta mucho para ser un 5 estrellas … al menos en el servicio

text:
We booked a deluxe room and requested a higher floor (the hotel confirmed this would be sorted). When arrived, the receptionist mentioned we have a ‘double upgrade’ which was a family suite. We are a couple, and did not need a family suite and it was a studio not a suite! As we did not like the room, we were given a deluxe room on the first floor which stank of mould and humidity. After viewing two rooms the receptionist had one other room which she was reluctant to show us. After she got off the phone with the manager they agreed to give this deluxe room to us (she mentioned in Sinhalese to her manager she did not want to give this room to us, assuming we would not understand).

We requested a double bed however this room had two single beds which were pushed together. As we were tired after traveling and checking two different rooms we agreed not to move again. I mentioned this to the reception and no action was taken.

Furthermore, the dinner was absolutely atrocious and the food was bland! It did not feel like we were in a hotel in Kandy Sri Lanka.

On a positive note, the breakfast buffet was good and the showers were excellent!
title: Absolutely bang average! Not a five star hotel

placeInfo/address: #12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Our visit to Grand Serendib started off excellent, we were warmly welcomed with drinks on arrival and assisted with our bags. The receptionists were also very welcoming. After spending an afternoon exploring Kandy we returned for a late afternoon swim and drinks. Despite offering a wide range of cocktails, they seemed to not have the alcohol required to make them. My wife must have requested three or four different cocktails which they were unable to make. 

After a freshen up we returned to the restaurant for dinner and this is where we were extremely disappointed. Our stay was expensive but we thought we would make the most of a fancy hotel and opting for something other than a Sri Lankan curry. We attempted to order the duck spring rolls and Australian strip loin steak for main but you guessed it, they didn’t have either. Never mind, we ordered salmon and tuna carpaccio and another type of steak. The fish in the carpaccio hadn’t fully defrosted and some were still frozen so that was sent back. Next was the pièce de résistance, the steak. In hindsight I have learnt not to order a particular meat in a country where it is not widely eaten. No steak knife was brought to the table, another sign of what was to come. I ordered medium/rare and the outside was as tough as a British expat’s skin who has spent the last twenty years in the Benidorm sun. After sawing through the poor thing I was met with a dilemma, do I try to call a vet to bring the poor thing back to life or make a complaint, I opted for the latter. The waiter tried to protest it had been correctly cooked. For our safety, we opted for some basic pasta which was okay. Given our misfortunes we were surprised not one person came to check how our (third time lucky) meal was. 

To their credit they did take the food off the bill. Such a shame, our room was comfy and you have spectacular views over Kandy but unfortunately bar and restaurant severely let the place down.
title: Al the gear, no idea…

text:
I was really looking forward to my stay at Heritance Kandalama, but unfortunately, it was a huge disappointment. The check-in process took nearly two hours, with little communication and no sense of urgency from the staff. After a long journey, being left waiting around with no updates was beyond frustrating.

Dinner was another letdown- not only were the portions shockingly small for the price in Sri Lanka, but the menu options were also very limited for the non-buffet dinner. For a hotel of this standard, I expected much better service and value.

To be fair, the breakfast was good, and the rooms were comfortable, but nothing can make up for the shocking check-in experience. The slow service and lack of hospitality completely overshadowed the hotel’s stunning location and design. A 1-star experience, and I wouldn’t stay here again.
title: Very poor experience.

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed on mid December for two nights but this stay was not satisfactory. First thing I felt is the staff didn’t guided us well. No one guided us firmly, what are the activities to do. (Eg-We asked the route to the library but they didn’t care).Seems like they oriented foreign visitors than locals. Not a kids friendly place. Indoor games  were promoted by posters and banners but they were not available (since we stayed in rainy season). So ultimately nothing to do in rainy days. Some staff members and their head office service was nice. Food was nice but service is not exceptional.They hadn’t provided the necessary things ( spoons,forks etc) when we were having meals. On the second day, we changed the room since the previous suite was dull, in that case Mr. Sharaf and head office people were helped us a lot. Second suite was nice but didn’t provided some amenities and towels, bathrobes. We waited more than 2 hours to get those things to our room. So, overall, not recommended for families with kids. Specially in rainy season. We felt these things much coz we stayed at jetwing lake before staying kandalama, jetwing service was exceptional
title: Not nicer than I thought

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
We were really disappointed with the cleanliness of the room. First of all, they only warn you about monkeys, but you should also be prepared for cockroaches. When we reported the cockroach we found in the room to the reception while checking out, their first response was, "They are everywhere."

Even two-star motels handle this type of issues more professionally than this. (It took some time for someone to come and discuss the issues we had. But there was no point since everything was already over)

Then we found strands of hair on the face towels that were given to us.

The room design is very outdated. There was only one usable power outlet, and you would need a long power cord to use it. Otherwise, you’ll have to keep your devices on the floor.

The pool attendant did not allow us to bring pool towels to our room. We were asked to leave the towels by the pool, so we had to walk back to our room shivering in the cold.

These experiences completely ruined our vacation. Save your money and stay somewhere else that is truly worth what you spend and “clean”.
title: Stay somewhere else which is clean and more professional

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed here for our honeymoon and were extremely disappointed with our stay. On arrival our room wasn’t ready to check into as the previous guest hadn’t yet cleared their items from the room. Whilst staff were accommodating in trying to find an alternative room to stay in, this isn’t the standard we’d expect for a 5 star hotel. The furnishings and finishes in the room were also very poor. The shower handles were peeling and the toilet seat was orange. The soundproofing was also terrible and we could hear kids running back and forth in the late evening when we were trying to sleep. Furthermore, I got food poisoning whilst staying here, which ruined my trip and subsequent travel plans. We have complained and heard nothing back. Would not recommend staying here for the price!
title: Not a 5 Star hotel!

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Buchen Sie die Royal Suite ( die soll besser sei) oder erwägen Sie eine andere Unterkunft.
text:
Wir haben bei einer geplanten Check-in Zeit von 14.00 Uhr und Ankunft um 15.30 Uhr zunächst knapp eine halbe Stunde auf eine Gelegenheit zum Ausfüllen der Anmeldung gewartet. Das Monate voraus für 334 USD gebuchte Panoramic Room für drei war für zwei Personen gerichtet, der 'atemberaubende Blick' ging ins Unterholz. Der Manager meint, daß sei halt was man gebucht habe, ein anderes Zimmer sei auch gegen Aufpreis in den nächsten zwei Tagen nicht verfügbar. Da jedoch auf booking.com für den Folgetag sehrwohl Zimmer angeboten wurden handelt es sich entweder um einen fehlenden Überblick über die Buchungen im eigenen Haus oder eine dreiste Lüge um sich nicht weiter kümmern zu müssen.
Die Toilettenspülung reinigt die Schüssel nur inkompetent, das bemerkt man am Uringeruch im Bad am Folgetag.
Das Personal ist oftmals ungelernt, Kaffe und Wasser zum Frühstück gibt es erst auf mehrfache Nachfrage. 
In der Summe entsprechen diese Leistungen keinesfalls einem Fünfsternehotel - im Gegensatz zum Preis.
title: Habe mich in 40 Jahren von keinem Hotel so geneppt gefühlt

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
Pros: food, environment, cute monkeys( before they came in my room and flipped everything)

Cons: 
1. The doorman made our luggage broken while unloading it from the car. (It’s a Rimova, but we can send it back to be repaired with fees after we finish this trip, so we didn’t ask for any compensation)

2. Monkey came in the room through the balcony and flipped our luggage, took away one bag of underwear. It was the housekeeping to be blamed, because we departed for day trip at 10 am that day, they did the housekeeping after we left, and when we came back to the room, we found it terrible, the balcony door was opened, our luggage was flipped out, sugar bags are opened and many ants are on the table, our herb medicine was opened as well, the monkey even tried some of these herb medicine, meanwhile, on the bed there was a nice note left by the housekeeping men, which is funny because it proved that this was not our bad.

3. Insufficient sincereness. Once after we checked in, I found the room in the lowest floor with hardly no views, I just asked the staff that if it was possible to change to a higher floor, the staff seemed to answer me immediately, even with no thinking: “no, this type of room you booked is only in 2nd floor”. I bought in at that time. But after the Monkey Accident, I requested to change a room, they led me to a 4-floor room, I found this new room was totally the same type( same size, same layouts) as the one I was offered in the first day, which made me feel upset because it shows the hotel's insincere attitude and service towards customers.

Follow ups with the Monkey Accident, the hotel insisted that this was the first time that they have encountered such accident, but I don’t believed it because there are Monkeys everywhere in the Hotel area, but I understand, it’s harder for them to just admit the fault
title: Monkeys are not cute

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is in an absolutely stunning location. It's hard to think of anywhere else we've been in the world where the backdrop is as beautiful as it is here. When you first walk in and see the lake set against the mountains and jungle it really takes your breath away and has the wow factor.
Unfortunately, though, the hotel itself doesn't match up to its incredible surroundings. It's a real shame as it definitely has the potential to be something amazing but it requires an extensive refurb. 
Besides the fact that generally the furniture and common areas are very tired (the lifts in particular feel ancient!) the hotel generally feels very very bare. For example there are only about 12 sun beds in the main pool area, and there are no umbrellas or service in that area - despite boiling heat!
The other 2 pool areas feel even stranger, with just a couple of mismatched loungers sporadically dotted around. When you walk through the lobby you enter into an expansive empty space - if they added some nice furniture this could be a nice space for guests to relax too but there's nothing! The restaurants are also just a bit odd and empty. 
Whilst the refurb would obviously require a lot of time and money, just furnishing the areas better would surely be very easily achievable. We found ourselves wandering around the hotel not sure where to sit and what to do as there was just nowhere to chill and relax. Perhaps worth it as a one night stay only to see Sigrya rock and then leave as you don't want to be stuck here for too long. 
Check in is also advertised as being at 2pm but our suite wasn't ready at this time when we'd arrived after a very long flight. Service is hit and miss
title: Stunning view - shame about everything else

text: Sadly the hotel is soul less. It looks like a building built during Cold War. Dark and no atmosphere. Lacks character and at best is an average 3 star. Even the ala carte restuarant had no aspect. Dark and just a hall with no views. I was fooled into thinking it was an upscale hotel. Far from it. Checked out after one night but they will not refund my second night. Tells you everything about the place. AVOID IT
title: Soulless hotel

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don’t go there! Avoid food there. Avoid the whole area
text:
My worst experience at a 5 star hotel!!
Where to begin… as we arrived we were quite impressed with the surroundings and the architecture of the building. Inside however nothing was maintained or updated - it was actually rather nasty! The hotel rooms are really old and dark. Not a place where you would like to spend any time or where you feel welcome or comfortable. Especially the bathroom really needs renovation. Throughout the hotel there also is no place where you could spend some time to sit or do something (like a comfortable lobby or beds in a spa area). As it was raining there was literally nothing to do in this place - also you couldn’t do anything outside. We asked for spa treatments but they didn’t have any available (for 3 days). It was very unprofessional. To the question of what we could do there we got the response: do you like pingpong?What a joke!! Besides the lack of amenities and activities the service was also really bad! We had an awful experience at the a la carte restaurant (also really the only option is to eat at the hotel as there are no restaurants in the area). We waited for more than 2 hours for our food. The food itself was not tasty and very disappointing. Definitely not even quality and appearance of a 3 star hotel with European prices. Later we found out that the same thing we ordered was just taken from the buffet (we saw it in the morning at the breakfast buffet). We were very upset and talked to the restaurant manager - where we got offered a 10% discount what we found ridiculous. Also outside of the restaurant the hotel was badly organised. Everything you ordered (very simple thing like a sandwich or  fruit) took always an hour to come (but mostly was not understood or they forgot about it). The staff overall l is not trained well. There needs to be a better manager (in the restaurant, reception, spa, etc). It was overall very unprofessional. When we wanted to express our disappointment and experiences to Dominic, nothing was done. No solutions, no suggestions on how to make our stay better, nothing. Dominic ultimately was very useless and didn’t fulfill his job as guest relations manager. Even after telling him that we want to leave a day early because of the hotel there was nothing done about that. I definitely don’t recommend staying at this hotel or coming there for dinner! The overall quality is awful - especially for the price and the 5 stars. Don’t trust the good reviews!! Don’t be fooled.
title: Terrible experience at Heritance Kandalama. Worst 5 star resort in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid at all cost!!
text:
Avoid!!!

I went to Heritance Kandalama with my Husband, Son, and a friend in August. We were to meet couple of our friend there  for High Tea.

When I contacted the hotel and asked in advance, I was told  that we could walk in and no need to book for high tea.
So we walked in.
At the Reception I was told that if we were going to have high tea, we needed to have booked an hour in advance!

Since we didn't have time, as we were on our way to Kandy, we decided to have some snacks instead. We were told that we could go to the cafe from where we can order the snacks.

We were directed to the Bar area which didn't look like a cafe.

There were 6 of us and the tables were for 4 people. The Staff accommodated us by connecting 2 round tables together which wasn't good for 6 people to sit comfortably, as some didn't have the table space!
I tried to speak to a member of staff about this but they appeared to be busy greeting some guests who have just arrived,  offering them soft drinks.

We ordered these snacks:
'Crispy French Fries'- Believe me, they were not crispy but soggy! We paid Rs.5000 (about £12) for 2 portions! 
A portion of butter cake and a portion of fruit cake both together cost us almost Rs.5000 (£12) again. They were so dry my elderly guest couldn't eat it. I did try a piece and they were so dry as if they are stale.
We ordered Iced Coffee which was Rs.1450 but had a very slight taste of Coffee but it wasn't Iced Coffee!
My Son's Vanilla milkshake was almost Rs.2000 (£4)  it was as if he was having cold milk! Honestly, that's not the milk shake that is expect from a reputed hotel.
We had some Mutton Samosas and tea which were satisfactory.-No complaints there.
In fact, our food were never served together either. While some tried to have their dry cake, others had to wait for their soggy crisps.

We spent Rs.22,100 (approximately £53) for the snacks we had. I didn't expect to pay much less than that since it was a 5* hotel,  but I expected better quality and service. It was MY treat to my family and friends and I felt embarrassed beyond belief!

I'm very disappointed and feel let down and robbed a nice get-together with my friends.

I did contact the hotel but after enquiring me where I was based (Kandy, not where the hotel is) and how long I was going to be in Sri Lanka (we were to leave in 2 days) we were invited for either High Tea or Dinner, knowing that we would not be able to make it! 

Think twice if you are going there, you would be better off at a bakery!
title: Terrible Experience!

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: I cannot recommend this hotel to any traveler.
text:
On the night of June 25th, 2023, my family and I had a reservation for room 327 at the esteemed Heritance Kandalama hotel. However, I must express my disappointment with the check-in process. Despite having paid the full price through online booking, it took an unexpectedly long time to complete the check-in procedures and reach our room. This was particularly frustrating considering the hotel's five-star rating. While two staff members were present at the front desk, they seemed preoccupied and did not attend to my family's needs promptly, even after obtaining photocopies of our local ID cards. Eventually, I had to approach another hotel staff member to inquire about the delay. After my follow-up, they accompanied me to the hotel lobby area where we were provided with refreshing drinks and wet towels.
Upon my arrival, there was only one other family waiting to check in. However, as the front desk staff took longer to assist me, more groups of guests arrived, making the front desk even busier. I observed the staff collecting signatures from guests who arrived after me, which surprised me as they seemed unconcerned about completing the check-in process for my family and me. The check-in time was 2 pm, and we arrived at around 4:30 pm, so the delay had nothing to do with room readiness and was solely due to the negligence of the front desk staff.
When I questioned why my family and I were being kept in the lobby without having our forms signed and being checked into our room, I pointed out that we had arrived earlier than the other groups. Finally, the staff arranged the necessary paperwork, obtained our signatures, and escorted us to our room. However, we then waited an additional 20 minutes for our luggage to arrive. Growing impatient, I contacted the front desk to remind them to send our luggage, and they promptly delivered it within five minutes. Unfortunately, these delays had a negative impact on my children, aged 15 and 10, who were eager to relax by the pool after their exhausting climb of the famous Sigiriya rock earlier in the day. If not for these setbacks, they would have had more time to enjoy the pool and make the most of our stay.
To add to our disappointment, when we finally made our way to the pool, there were no towels available. Once again, I had to request assistance from a pool attendant to provide us with fresh towels. These instances, coupled with other management issues throughout the hotel, gave the impression of a lack of proper guidance and organization. The only redeeming aspects were the pleasant natural surroundings and satisfactory food, although the variety was limited. Furthermore, I was disappointed to find that the shops on the hotel premises were already closed by 9:30 am the following day.
Based on my experience, I cannot recommend this hotel to any traveler.
title: Disappointing Check-in Experience at Heritance Kandalama Hotel: A Tale of Delays and Mismanagement

roomTip: It's high end jungle lodge.
text:
My husband and I just came back from a beautiful trip to Sri Lanka. We had a very hectic itinerary so we decided to put aside the last two days of the trip just for relaxation. We were looking forward for these last two days immensely as we got a room in one of the top 50 hotels in the world. We booked the luxury suite at a whopping high price of 324 dollars per night, so of course we were looking forward for a lavish and comfortable stay. 

“Name of hotel” is in the top 50 hotels of the world because of its architecture. It has been built in the middle of a cave without disrupting any of the existing nature surrounding it. My husband is a bird photographer and nature enthusiast so it was a dream come true for him. Full marks for the beautiful breath taking view however, when you pay such a large amount of money, you expect that level of treatment. 

To our disappointment, the stay was below average. There was absolutely nothing special about room or food or services. Their staff was not trained at all and no one had a clue about their responsibilities. Room was lacking basic facilities.  Buffet was a fish market and it’s not even tourist season right now. After paying so much we were expecting a variety of cuisines or choices. The chef was willing to cook anything we asked for but he didn’t have any knowledge about thai food, sushi (there were alot of Japanese customers there) or even tofu. 

Our worst nightmare happened at night when we returned to our room after a long and tiring day to find that the AC was not working. I thought “okay, let me open up the balcony and we can sit in the open air for a while”. Turns out that the huge, beautiful balcony they had given us could not even be opened because of the risk of monkeys and snakes in the jungle. Imagine you are tired and 3-4 male working in your room at 11 in the night when you were planning on unwinding for the day. The Duty manager came in, was on call with others , don't know as they were speaking in other language. For 1 hour they were trying to fix it and I was just sitting there, exhausted. I couldn’t even take a shower. Finally, at 12 in the night they offered to switch our room. The other room was just a small room with one bed which is not what we paid for at all. That night we decided to just stay in our room as It was the last night and we had an early checkout anyway.

The next morning we asked to speak to the main manager. We weren’t expecting anything back but I felt like I had to say something at least so that this same experience doesn’t happen to anyone else.  

Update : they have agreed to give us back 100 dollars which is nothing compared to what we paid. 

I am writing this so that if you are planning on staying here, don’t book the expensive room as the view is breathtaking from every corner of the hotel so don’t waste money on that. Just go with the basic room categories and enjoy!!
title: Highly disappointed/over hyped property

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
What a disappointment!
We had heard great things about this hotel, and were excited to visit…. Unfortunately it does not live up to expectations.
The building is beautiful and the lake view - incredible. BUT, the hotel is old, the food is average and the decor non-existent.  You walk around a building with blank walls, and echoing corridors, to a restaurant with cold, boring, very average food.
For the price they charge, this is not worth it. There are plenty of other “special” hotels close by, stay elsewhere.
title: Overrated, overpriced and underwhelming

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
I recently had the opportunity to stay at this hotel and wanted to share my experience. 

Firstly, I noticed that I was overcharged for the boat trip that I booked through the hotel. The amount billed was significantly higher than the quoted price, which led to some confusion and inconvenience. 

Additionally, I experienced a couple of maintenance-related issues in my room. The air conditioning unit would not turn off, causing the room to be uncomfortably cold and resulting in a restless night. Consequently, I was awake from 4 am and had difficulty getting the rest I needed. Furthermore, the locker in my room was not functioning properly, which made securing my belongings more challenging than it should have been.

These issues combined gave me the impression that the overall maintenance and hospitality at the hotel were somewhat subpar.
title: Rough at the edges

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: The good is the Sri Lankan staff who actually run the place and are charming, professional and go above and beyond trying to serve the guests while juggling the needs of the owner and his wife who live at the Villa and whom the staff wait on as well. The bad is the rude owner who makes it clear guests are to fit in with his routine and not get in the way of his lifestyle ( just fund it) I'm aware that when other reviewers have complained about the behaviour and attitude of the owner he responds by attacking them in writing in a sneering aggressive manner while pointing out his positive reviews and I see from other reviews that he will accept no honest feedback and criticism of his behaviour. I ask you to judge how he reacts to this review in deciding whether you wish to stay with him. In reality staying at the Villa Rosa is staying with him in his home as he lives alongside the guests and requires them to eat meals, go to bed (wifi switched off at 10pm )to suit his routine  and as a guest you are made to feel uncomfortable and unwanted when his wife is swimming in the pool or they are enjoying a meal together in the restaurant. It is sort of like an awkward uncomfortable Air B and B set up living in his home. There is a large sign in your room about the tip box for the staff ( I always tip staff but it is necessary to have a large sign telling me how to behave) We had trouble finding the Villa, which is very hard to find in the dark and had to ring several times to try and get directions. We were greeted by the owner with "`I hear you have been making a commotion, you have the smallest room I hope you  manage". We did although the mini bathroom means there is not enough water for a hot shower and it runs out quickly. We were also made to feel our lateness meant we should eat dinner as quickly as possible and go to our room as it was lights out time. It was about 9pm. During our two day stay the owner made a point of ignoring us and talking to other guests, he makes his rounds at dinner, and when we were leaving and our driver was again having difficulties finding the villa to pick us up the Sri Lankan staff tried to help while waiting on the owner at lunch who ignored us despite us being paying guests,  as serving him was clearly the staff's priority. I could go on..I have not had to write a single other negative review from our three weeks travelling around Sri Lanka and am aware that the owner will attack me in writing for daring to be honest about his behaviour that many other reviewers have also commented on but in order for other travellers ( and a friend at Audley Travel that asked me to give an honest opinion in light of others complaining about the attitude of the owner ) I have been honest in this review
title: Fantastic Staff let down by rude owner

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't stay here
text: Villa Rosa is located on top of a steep hill and has a magnificent view over the Valley. The hotel is very small - more like a large house. Our room was quite run down and not very clean. There was a mosquito net over the bed that had dead flies on it. The door to the room was warped and extremely difficult to close. We needed to keep the curtains closed because the design of the hotel means some of the rooms look directly into each other. The food was only ordinary. The hotel played very poor quality loud live music for around 5 hours so we couldn't sleep or read. Some of the other hotel guests got extremely drunk and ran around the hotel yelling and shrieking until nearly midnight and the hotel staff did nothing about it. There was no tv in the room, no phone and no number to contact reception. I'm only giving 2 stars because of the view. I do not recommend this hotel.
title: Nice view but that's about all

ownerResponse/text:
Sorry for the experience of not having hot water - as it should be. It should have worked, but that did not help you. In that case please let us know, so that we could have attended to the matter. It can happen, that a fuse went off or something else went wrong. As far as the transfer to town is concerned, we try to make clear in our webpage as well as in further communication, that we only provide the drop in town, but we give advise how to come back at at what price. Obviously there were communication problems we normally do not have.
Thank you for your visit.
placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Villa Rosa is good if you are really looking for a place to stay that is not in the heart of the city as you can be out of the hustle and bustle within 10 mins. 

This accommodation unfortunately was one I did not like and wished I had not stayed in. 

The staff were lovely, however, no one spoke a lot of English so we had a massive language barrier. 

There were only around 4 mins of hot water a day in our room (we had the honeymoon suite) so we had to split it 2 mins each, which meant the bath on the terrace was unusable (unless you like cold baths). 

They advertise a tuk tuk service into the town for free on their website, when we asked for this they said they booked one, however then said they didn't understand what I was saying when I was referring back to the free service so we paid for this (it did not cost a lot, it was just the principle of the fact we didn't get what they said they would offer).  

The food was not amazing, we only had breakfast here but it was the worst place we had breakfast over the 10 different accommodations on this month-long trip we were doing. I had the Sri Lankan one morning and it was cold, I had to ask if they could heat it up. 

All in all, I would say stay in the town or find another place that takes you out of the city as there are a few places around :)
title: Not the best place, I would avoid.

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
We looked forward to a special family holiday for months and having hand picked Villa Rosa we left bitterly disappointed on a number of levels.

The welcome we received on arrival was short and indifferent, as if going through the motions and we had disturbed an afternoon sleep. 

Our room was not air conditioned and one toilet was to cater for 4 adults - not ideal. 

The positives are the views - outstanding- and the energy and enthusiasm of one, young employee. We rarely saw anyone else. 

The biggest issue we encountered was the bill on exiting.  We were charged 2300 LKR for a curry and 1000 for a Cheese & Tomato sandwich .... but then had a 10% Service and the previously unheard of 17% VAT charges added - making the curry nearly 3000SKR each.  The highest previously paid was 1100SKR.  This exceeds prices in the UK and whilst enjoyable was not the best we had in SL and way overpriced.  

Bizarrely my “invoice” was only hand written on Hotel letter headed paper - I would expect a formal printed  bill especially when VAT is involved?. We have not had VAT added to a single other bill, nor has it been referenced by any other business. 

Our departure elicited an even lower rated response than our arrival.  Nobody thanked us for staying at Villa Rosa and the Manager was quite happy to let us depart with no platitudes or good wishes or even a farewell wave.  Totally different to the welcomes, stays or departures from other, classier hotels we have experienced in SL.  

We left feeling unwanted and ripped off.  Based on this experience I cannot recommend Villa Rosa.
title: Hugely disappointing & a rip off

ownerResponse/text:
Sorry for this miscommunication - but we try to explain on our webpage why we have this policy of a minimum stay of 2 nights: we think it is not worth for our guests nor for us to create too much of in and out so that this place will be converted into a bus stand where half the guests are coming and the other half is going. We try to offer something different, sharing this special location with our guests - but to make this happen we expect a minimum stay of 2 nights. There are exceptions but obviously it did not work in this case. 
I have my doubts whether anybody who never had the chance to visit Villa Rosa has the authority to judge our customer service? But there are enough reviews from other people who visited us - so we do not need to worry too much about this miscommunication. We should have explained our policy and I am sure this party would not have written this review.
placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Don't bother trying to book for one night, don't spend 10 minutes filing out the booking form, don't bother reading through 2 automated email responses, you'll get a simple, gentle, very nice response from the helpdesk "we don't accept one night bookings !!!" 
That's it, no hello, no thank you for considering our place, NOTHING... Just stay out of places like this, tells you a lot about what to expect during your stay
title: Horrendous customer service

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Very nice view, overlooking a beautiful valley and river (especially early in the morning!). However, the hotel isn't anything at all special.  Rooms have been renovated, but lack any character and attention to detail.  Floor was unclean, beds poorly made up (sheets too short for the bed...), no shampoo/soap in the bathroom (one towel for two people), and no hot water (I appreciate this happens sometimes!).  I must respectfully disagree with those who thought the food was "fantastic" -- we had a curry dinner, which was quite bland, not enough in size, and likely came straight out of the microwave (we found a piece of plastic foil in our curry).  Would not define this a boutique hotel - B&B is a much more appropriate definition.
title: Nice view, but that's about it

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
I booked the room here well in advance but was disappointed to find it was basically an entry hall that had been converted into a guestroom. It was cramped and not at all private: windows on both sides of the bed looked directly onto the courtyard through which everyone passes as well as the hotel entrance/parked cars on street level. The room was also loud, because of its location. The towels were raggedy and didn't really seem clean. 

To be fair, the location overlooking the river is beautiful but a bit far from Kandy, and the food is quite good. They also organized a good driver for a day trip, but I think most hotels in Sri Lanka can do that well. 

The hotel staff were also kind and helpful but the manager was extremely unpleasant (never actually met him but heard him shouting at his staff member who told him I was leaving early because of the room) and wanted to charge me for the extra night. 

I would not recommend the Villa Rosa, there are plenty of other options.
title: disappointing stay at over-priced Villa Rosa

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: We made it all the way to the villa just to find out that they don't have a bed for our driver. The villa was completly empty and it looked like we would have been the only guests. We found it very strange.
title: No bed for driver

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
We just stayed in this hotel for one night and we were disppointed.  In my opinion this is a budget hotel not a boutique hotel.  I did not feel we received value for money at all.

The view from the hotel was lovely and the staff and the owner charming, but the rooms were very tired.  The pillows were old and small and the linens and towels desperately needed replacing.

Everything in the hotel could have done with a good clean and the food was at best ok.

The botanical gardens were worth a visit, but the tooth temple was crowded and we felt completely rushed.  We visited the cultural dance show and it was surprisingly good.  The dances interesting and energetic.
title: Tired needs a revamp

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Kandy is a very busy and crowded town, with markets, architecture dating back centuries, places of interest like the Hotel Suisse and is a UNESCO world heritage site.  Well worth just wandering around.

The Villa Rosa is an oasis of calm at the top of an almost vertical climb up the hill overlooking the Mahawell River, the island’s longest.  We were welcomed by the German owner and shown around the hotel, which is quite small and informal, set within small, beautiful hibiscus gardens.  We were even shown around the kitchen and introduced to the chef.  

Each room has a private balcony or terrace and meals can be taken anywhere.  Our room was of medium size and to be frank rather tired looking, the mattress on the large bed was probably new when Sri Lanka gained it’s independence.  There was no comfortable chair to relax in and inadequate hanging/storage space.  The bathroom was adequate, but perhaps the towels and bath mat should be replaced.  The worst thing was the complete lack of privacy, the window looked out into the communal courtyard and the French doors, which opened onto the terrace (allegedly our private seating area), was in fact just a thru route for staff and guests alike. 

The Villa Rosa claims to be a premium boutique hotel….perhaps it was once, however charming staff and a great location do not compensate for worn and tired furniture and décor. There is a separate ayuvedic building but again this could do with revamping but cost of treatments were very reasonable.

The chef is very willing and although western food is offered,  beware it is served with a Sri Lankan twist … so no plain old grilled pork chops (despite a specific and detailed request for just that).  Sights to see are: Sigiriya Rock Fortress (beware of the ‘helpers’ who are very intrusive and my husband and I found the only way to get rid of them is to quite loudly say no – one helper actually asked us for money to go away).  The cultural show in Kandy town is so so but the tourist board really needs to put in more funding as it is quite amateurish.  Visitors can also go into the Temple of the Buddha’s Tooth but my husband and I felt as though we, as paying tourists, were intruding upon the genuine homage being paid by the Buddhist devotees there.
title: TIRED

I attended a wedding of my known recently, the food was tasteless!
The fish curry was awful.
The chicken curry was terrible, it had only the drumsticks, that too wasn't cooked well! How come you put only one part from the chicken? It was like a combination of raw meat and chilli mixed water!
I'm pretty sure the Chef doesn't know how to make the chicken & fish curries!
Even at home, once you cook you taste before serving others, if you have a manager in the hotel his prime responsibility should be tasting the food before the function starts! 
Many of us did not eat!
I won't recommend this food for any other future functions 😔
Need more admin in f&b service, not enough staffs available for the service! 
Staffs were kind!
Hope you all quickly improve the shortfalls, otherwise people will start to avoid this such a nice property 👍
title: Awful

Even though it was freezing all doors and windows could not close probably.
